Reviews.Title: “One of the worlds finest hotels and I speak from experiance.”
Reviews.Author: Adrian B
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in the world without doubt! My wife and I have stayed at this hotel since it was in the Demure group and even though it has changed owners since then standards have not slipped in each of my 9 stays over the years. I have been through the range of rooms as my fortunes have changed so would consider myself a good judge of this hotel. Somtimes the staff will offer upgrades and free parking but this is not the sort of establisment that you should expect freebies, it is expensive but worth every penny. Service and food are always great as is the location and ambiance. If you are in the market for a suite its well worth asking the reservation staff if there are any VIP apartments avaialble, at least twice the price but oh my they are somthing special and will give you a memory you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “So Luxury!!!”
Reviews.Author: StarbucksFreak25
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 5 minutes away from the city center. The building is just fantastic inside as outside.. new and old linked together, decore is amazing! The interior is warm and modern. Rooms are large and extremely comfortable. Restaurant is very stylish and has a fantastic garden. Staff is very professional and nice.

Reviews.Title: “So good, we didn't want to come home!!!!”
Reviews.Author: llovenz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best we have ever stayed in. We booked the Junior Suite, but i am sure that we were upgraded to an apartment, with Butler service. The room was huge and was amazing. Loving the My Bed. Best nights sleep in a long time!! We chose this hotel for a special birthday celebration and we were treated wonderfully. It was quite overwhelming. To begin with we checked in early and shown to our room by our lovely butler, who was fantastic, so helpful. The hotel then sent up a birthday cake, which they organised. A total surprise. We asked our butler which Indonesian restaurant he could recommend, and he actually booked us one we had seen on the web prior to us coming to Amsterdam. But thought it was too late to book as booking is done well in advance, but he managed to get us a table, which was fantastic. It was called Tempo Doeloe, highly recommend it (thats another review). The breakfast, with complementary champagne was great and the staff new it was my husbands birthday, and brought him in a Dutch apple cake with candle (more like a flare) and the waitress, who was so lovely sang to him, amazing voice. We felt so spoilt. During our stay there were so many other things that the hotel did for us that made our stay spectacular. On our last day the hotel let us have a later check out time as they new we were getting a later flight and arranged a transfer to the airport. Overall, all the staff at the hotel made our stay so much more than what we were expecting, it was quite sad to leave. Since we have been back, we have recommended the hotel to all our friends and family. Thank you all so much. Brilliant memories of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLooch
Reviews.Content: Even on top floor rooms are very comfortable. Great bar for drinks, and breakfast excellent. Central location means no need for trams or taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Almost didn't stay - glad we did”
Reviews.Author: carorab
Reviews.Content: Like others, I almost did not stay here because of the negative comments about proximity to the red light district and noise. We are on the 3rd floor, overlooking the canal and it is lovely. No noise at all. The red light district is not close - you have to make an effort to get there. We have stayed previously at the Fusion Suites and although liked it very much, we wanted to be a bit more central and have more amenities. The Fusion is really a B&B. The Sofitel is very comfortable, and although a larger luxury hotel it retains it dutch feeling. The area is lovely and central to everything. I was on my own a good deal as my husband was attending a conference and at no time did I worry about walking on my own or around the area of this hotel. The concierge has sent us to wonderful restaurants (not touristy ones - more where the dutch would eat). the staff are very friendly and always remember our names. After a long day walking, I truly appreciated the long deep bathtub. If you want a cute canal house - this is not for you but if you want luxury, amenities, excellent staff and a great location, then look at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: drivervet
Reviews.Content: Ignore the reviews saying this hotel is in the red light district and a seedy part of the city. It is a beautiful hotel, in its own courtyard. My wife and I walked all over Amsterdam from the hotel, and never felt we were in an undesirable area. The staff were very helpful, the rooms were lovely, well equipped and a good size. The fish restaurant was well worth visiting as well, with some really tasty dishes. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 Days March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Mark U
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thursday and were welcomed by the doorman. Checking was easy but we were not shown to our room and the presentation of the hotel services and facilities was all too brief. The room was a good size and well maintained and the housekeeper was always on hand to assist if necessary. We have no complaints regarding noise from either inside or outside the hotel in the evenings. Whilst having a quiet drink in the bar a mouse appeared around my girlfriends feet. This was reported to the barman and he joked that it was probably the cheeseboard that attracted it. We took an hours tour on the hotel boat which was very pleasant and we were lucky enough to be the only couple. A nice trip but no narrative from the skipper. On the whole very good but not sure the staff treat all guest alike perhaps.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: larstobi
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with very friendly staff. Clean, spacious rooms, nice bathrooms. They could have some more cushion on the pillow topper for the bed for my preference. The windows are not sound proofed. The door is not sound proofed at all. The location is said to be near Red Light district but it is actually far enough to not notice anything at all. There are often celebrities staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: leahbx
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel! Felt as I'd we we're treated like royalty from the moment we stepped foot through the doors. The bed is just amazing, so so comfortable! Truly a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience!!”
Reviews.Author: ranirahul
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the hotel on Thursday, greeted by a host and a lovely Butler Domingo! We were celebrating our anniversary and were treated like a prince and princess! our luggage was misplaced so stress levels were up, but the butler chased this up regularly! We had a suite room which was outstanding with views of the canal, The bathroom was lovely, and the bedroom so romantic! Lovely size bed! Loved everything about the stay, hotel is a walk way from all the shops/rest and the staff are all so pleasant! We even got treated like VIP at the restaurant Domingo booked for us where we got a special table too! Loved it, want to do it al again! Thank you for the amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lanzlady
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel in luxury double room overlooking the canal. Beautiful bed with feather topper so comfy turndown service each night with bottle evian water and beautiful truffle bath with TV on the wall large wet room we wil be returning to his hotel next year very friendly polite staff and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Sagittarius_7
Reviews.Content: Good points - interesting old building Helpful staff Good room with canal view Bad points - the area is a bit grim, the proximity to the red light district means you may get woken by noise on the street at 3am. The hotel, while generally good, is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: oznick
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few hotels in Amsterdam and most have been very ordinary in terms of the facilities and style; I am happy to report a change; Sofitel! ACCOR and Sofitel The Grand Amsterdam have done a really great job in renovating and very old worn out product and given it a new lease of life for several years to come. The public areas are small but beautifully done; the rooms once again decent size for Amsterdam and decorated to suit most tastes. I have stayed in several Sofitels world wide and even brought a Sofitel MyBed over mattress; however these beds MUST be the best beds I have ever slept in! Give it a try you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay There Again!”
Reviews.Author: lwdem
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the Sofitel The Grand Amsterdam, on a layover en-route to Kenya. My room was very nice overlooking a canal. There was a slight odour in the room but it was immediately remedied. My jeans got soaked from the rain while out exploring the city and the housekeeping staff collected them from my room and put them in the hotel dryer. They were returned with 40 minutes - no charge. All staff were very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Style and quality in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Crwydryn2
Reviews.Content: The Grand is a quadrangle of elegant rooms in the central area. The staff are warm and welcoming and show you individually to the cosy and well-specified rooms whilst your baggage is being brought up. The restaurant has deservedly won many awards and whilst being costly it's worth every penny for the devotion to fresh ingredients and professional service. There's a bargain lunch, which with a few glasses of wine may well deter you from touring further that day. A very well run establishment where you will feel valued, happy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous - house of horrors”
Reviews.Author: Albert W
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be the worst I have ever stayed in. It all started with check in, when I was given a room key to a room that was already occupied by others,... This was solved OK by the front office staff. I found the rooms to be tiny and extremely dark. Then we decided after a walk over the canals (make sure you don't turn right, because that's were the red light district is) to have dinner at the Bridges Restaurant. The service was again poor, with an arrogant hostess and so/so food. Breakfast was reasonably good, but then the great surprise came out upon check out; we were charged for minibar items that we never used (?!?) After complaining to this and speaking to the manager, this was waived. Will definitely not recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Details on facilities could be more detailed”
Reviews.Author: VeraJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently stayed over at this hotel. Generally the service was good although I would not have made a reservation at this hotel if I realized that the bathrooms offer showers only. I enjoy a soak in a hot bath after walking all day long day but had to suffice with a shower. The water leaked out from under the shower door over the bathroom floor and had to mopped up every time I sued the shower. Water from the wash hand basin drains very slowly. Location is very central as one can walk to most places of interest. Ask for a room higher up off the street as I was woken up at 3 o'clock one morning when 4 taxi drivers decided to have a disagreement outside my bedroom window. Also the garbage bins are moved out on the pavement in the mornings which cause a lot of noise. The steps up to the bathroom and/or down to the bedroom could also be a nuisance especially during the night. Towels, linen, pillows and so on were all in good condition. Overall quite good although I would not return to this property for the reasons given above.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, superb location”
Reviews.Author: marinbean
Reviews.Content: This hotel had exactly what we wanted for our stay in Amsterdam: an excellent location from which we could walk anywhere we wished to go in Amsterdam, outstanding service, comfortable rooms, and a luxurious feel. Prior to our trip, I emailed the concierge department with many questions. They were very skilled at anticipating what I would want to know next based on their answers, and I found this hotel exceptionally easy to deal with via email. They even called me in the USA from Amsterdam with a clarification, especially impressive as it would have been 4am their time. Our room was luxurious, spacious, and beautiful. We had been upgraded at no charge to a junior suite upon check-in. My husband and I each had our own sinks, and there was a towel warmer next to the large soaking tub. Every staff member was friendly and competent, and they were always asking how our stay was going and if they could do anything for us. We felt very pampered here. The decor is rich in color, fun, and modern despite the fact that the building is very historic and started out as a convent. The breakfast buffet is wonderful with every choice you could imagine available.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Legend Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 186338Kathryn
Reviews.Content: Very poor in every respect, bar closed early, barman had to look up how to make a cocktail, cold water in the shower, TV that didn't work - (I could do on). If you take advantage of one of the special offers you can expect a second rate service, a noisey room and staff who really don't want you to return.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: LCinChicago
Reviews.Content: There is no way this hotel is a five star hotel. We've stayed at five and six star hotels, and this is, at best, a 3-4 star hotel. At a true five star, one would expect most things to be seamless and offer excellent service with a great attention to detail. Nothing was seamless except for when it was time to pay on checking out. Let's start with the reservation process which was a bit of a headache. I emailed with them back and forth and inquired about the Stay 4, Pay 3 nights. One person confirmed the promotion, and another person quoted me the full price. I don't think it's too much to ask for people to read the chain of prior emails. I also asked for a room with one bed (it was our 1 year wedding anniversary celebration, and we wanted to be in the same bed - go figure). We had inquired about early check in, and upon arrival, we were delighted to hear our room was ready. When we walked in, there were two double beds. Not awesome. So we asked for another room, presuming it'd be comparable. Nope, the second room we got was most likely their emergency back up room because it was probably the worst room in the entire hotel (room 360, by the way). There's a large pole in the middle of the room, and it's directly above the entrance so you get to hear people's conversations. The butler who walked us to our new room was a bit pretentious and lacked all sense of warmth. He asked why we chose Amsterdam when there are many other cities like Paris and Rome. Odd question, I thought. I told him that we've been to all of the other cities he named, which quieted him. It certainly felt like he was making a presumption that all tourists were there to smoke pot, watch sex shows, and trash the city. Thanks for the implication. One thing people should be aware of - there is NO WATER PRESSURE in the shower head. Not a wonderful job with renovations if you can't offer water pressure. The cleaning service was not of even a four star caliber hotel. For one thing, they are extremely FRUGAL with their little bottles of Hermes product. It'd be empty or near empty and they still would not replace it. DonI'm amazed that people rated this hotel so well. If you have the fortunate opportunity to compare, go stay at a hotel equivalent to the Raffles or any five or six star hotel in Asia and you'll see a remarkable difference.'t pretend to offer luxury by offering Hermes when you don't replenish it. And if you're lucky, you might get one bottle of water at turn down service. You might get two if you're really, really lucky. Sometimes, we got no bottles of water. We dined at Bridges, which was a nice restaurant and did provide good service. It wasn't impeccable like La Rive, however. I'm surprised about all of the rave reviews on here. If you get the fortunate opportunity to compare, stay at a hotel equivalent to the Raffles or a true five or six star hotel in Asia and you'll see a noticeable difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, fab comfortable bed, great food!”
Reviews.Author: tja1230
Reviews.Content: Value for Amsterdam was ok, hotel is within walking distance of main attractions, only 20 mins walk from grand central station. I thought the room was ok, small only big enough for a cot beside the bed, looked under bed when we left only to find an empty juice bottle from previous tenants this was disappointing, but the staff and food made up for it all! The swimming pool is small but nice and warm. Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Birthday in style”
Reviews.Author: Lambrettali
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right in the heart of Amsterdam. When we arrived we were greeted by the hotel doorman who took our bags to the front desk. We had booked the hotel to celebrate my Birthday in style and because of that we were upgraded to a Junior Suit which was a pleasant surprise, they even brought a cake to the room. The room was fabulous, the bathroom had a walk in shower and the bath that was big enough for two had a television at one end, and two separate wash basins, The bed was huge with the feather and down duvet and top-mattress to wrap you up in soft, cozy comfort. We had the breakfast each morning and were amazed by the choices available, the service was amazing. Not once did a member of staff walk by without a smile and a welcome. The staff were all so kind, polite and professional. If you want to treat yourselves go here! I really would recommend staying in this hotel, not only for the luxury but the excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, top service !”
Reviews.Author: Eric G
Reviews.Content: location of the hotel is very nice, rooms are comfortable and this bed ... it is like sleeping in in the sky .... :-) amazing the staff, especially the butler tea, is efficient and can find you solutions to any of your problems breakfast is goooooood However,the gym could be bigger, it is quite small !

Reviews.Title: “Loved every bit of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Somit12 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a weekend in August and it was amazing. We booked a superior double room but when we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite with a butler service. It was great, the butler helped us book a table at a restaurant, and answered every question that we had. The room was great as well. The massage in the hotel's spa can only be recommended! The location was great as well. I can only recommend this hotel and we will be staying there again when in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “a memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Iaetitia
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay. Have rarely encountered such service-oriented staff in The Netherlands. My room was spacious and well equipped. Location is perfect. You get the feel of life along the canals and it is an easy walking distance from key sights and shops, including the flower market. Did not try the restaurants. Yes, it is pricey but you do get a lot in return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_G10184
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is an interesting exciting place but i was a bit sceptical about the hotel choices as there weren't many options for 5 star luxury which i am fanatical about. However when we checked into this hotel we were pleasantly surprised. The location is amazing as it is a short walk to the red light district and other interesting hot spots. We stayed in a luxury room and it was furnished nicely, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was quiet large and also very nice. The view out the window was of another building so didnt get much out of that. We ordered a few times from room service and the food was quiet enjoyable. Had dinner once at the Bridges restaurant, the service was good and so was the food. The concierge service was average and overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. This is not the most luxurious 5 star hotel you will stay in but in Amsterdam i think this was the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy location, elagant building very high quality service for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ozmaster13
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam more than 15 times, sometimes for fun but mostly for business, when you travel for business there is big chance you might be alone therefore I like to choose preperties with 24 hour room service centre location plus I love to walk a lot so central locaiton is crucial. I usually stay at Starwood Hotel Pulitzer which was nice between 2005-2008 but after the service went down. I also stayed at swiss and grand krasnoplolsy several times. Last september I had to have emergency trip to Amsterdam, I mean I learned my trip around 13.00 and I was at Schipnol Airport at 2100 the same day, the booking was done by my staff, I told them 5 star city centre and a good room. when I arrived I received an sms from my team that I am staying at Sofitel. ooops I have never been there before and had no idea. When I arrived I understood they choose one the best hotels in Amsterdam. The hotel is old dutch building,rooms with hign ceilings, but the best part it was all very modern, high tech and quiet. The bathrooms were amazing (because uncertain events I had to check out and re check in so I stayed in two different rooms.) the bed was all comfy I mean all was looking very new especially Ä±f you know the hotels in Amsterdam. Food was fine, as I said if you are alone room service gets very important. Location is crazy it right in the heart of the most crazy part Amsterdam, I mean 20m left of the hotel there were 3 coffee shops. it was a very high contrast for me, such luxury and elegant setting next to coffee shops and red light distirict I just loved it. I strongly suggest traveller who is looking for modern luxurius hotel in a elegant setting in the crazy heart of Amsterdam, they should go sofitel. Negative parts, Expensive and very small reception.

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubyhoo
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel , we had gone to amsterdam without booking a hotel and we were having trouble finding a suitable place. it was very expensive and on turning up there with our rucksacks and jeans on i did feel out of place but was made to feel welcome. the room was fantastic and comfortable. the hotel is in a brilliant position for exploring amsterdam. staff very friendly. if you want to treat yourselves go here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly perfect weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Mosparkle11
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a perfect stay! We had booked a junior suite yet on arrival were upgraded to a prestige suite which was unbelievable. We had a separate livingroom with all the amenities and more (Bose sound system, nespresso machine to name a few) the bathroom had a fantastic shower and bath with television and then a very comfortable and luxurious bed. We had a the breakfast each morning and were amazed by the food and choices available as well as later sampling some delicious cocktails! The location is fabulous, although at the red light district you would never be aware of this and it makes it so easy to explore the city centre on foot as everything is near by. I have to leave the best to last though, the service was just fantastic. Not once did a member of staff walk by without a welcome. The staff were all so kind, polite and efficient. On our first night my now fiancÃ©e proposed, on hearing this news we were then presented with a complimentary bottle of champagne and congratulated, adding to the wonderful moment. I really would recommend staying in this hotel, not only for the luxury but the excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “You know you are in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: Had the good fortune of staying in one of the suites. This hotel is superb in every respect. Flawless service in the Dutch style. The buildings are pure Amsterdam on the outside, feels like arriving at a small royal palace. Modern and elegant interiors. It is expensive however the value is there. 5 star price and 5 star service providing a quintessential Dutch luxury travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Restaurant in central Amsterdam (in our experience)”
Reviews.Author: DevDesai
Reviews.Content: We found the location of the hotel difficult to find but when we finally got there, we were really pleased. The location is excellent for central Amsterdam. The courtyard is immediately impressive and the hotel staff are friendly and helpful. For instance, we were recommended a brilliant little French restaurant for lunch on Sunday. The room are modern, well-equipped and very comfortable. I have been to Amsterdam 6 or 7 times and this is, by far, the best hotel I have stayed at. The room service is pretty good but we could not get enough of the delicious crepes. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in heart of Ams”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ..great location, very nice suites, excellent service - all in best part of Amsterdam. If you are looking for top notch service, with great rooms and also nice spa, this hotel will satisfy all your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 40th birthday!!”
Reviews.Author: Nonacrascall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, as my 40th birthday was on the 29th December. We had complimentary champagne upon arrival. The location is perfect for exploring beautiful Amsterdam and the staff were extremely helpful. We used the spa which was relaxing and therapeutic. We enjoyed champagne with the staff on the Thursday evening and tried some delicious cheese! Our room was comfy and was regularly tidied and freshened up. It was a birthday that I will always remember and I would love to return one day. Amsterdam is a fantastic and architecturally wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: Johan M
Reviews.Content: Check in 45 min due to a wrong arrival date. Twin room instead of DBL room booked 1 day to change the bed in Italian bed. Conciergerie push you to buy services all time If you are not rich, you will receive a different welcome and services. Taxi did not want to drive us until central station They debit my card 2 times without asking me and the made 1 week to re-credit it. For a 5 stars hotel, the service is worst than an ibis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic concierge”
Reviews.Author: Peter361
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the centre of town so we walked to all the attractions that we wanted to see. The standard rooms are not big but the suitable for us. The used the hotel transfer to and from the airport which made everything very easy as we arrived at different times and no one had to organize money. The highlight of our stay was the concierge Mr Udo Eshuijs who organized medicine for our daughter who had asthma and needed a puffer. He organized the hotel doctor to send a script to the chemist and sent a taxi to collect it then delivered it to the room personally. He suggested various restaurants that were all great and made our stay memorable. If you stay please use his recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Fairytale2010
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that this is the most amazing hotel I have ever stayed at! The room was absolutely wonderful; including a free standing bath in the middle of our huge bathroom. The MyBed was so comfortable, that it was really difficult to drag myself out of there. The service was great, and the breakfast delicious. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence is hospitality”
Reviews.Author: kingkelly77
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at the Grand a few times in Amsterdam and this December was there for 3 nights. The hotel and it's staff are excellent and you can't fault it one bit. The Christmas decor is beautiful and the open fireplace in the library is great for relaxing in front of. We also enjoyed champagne with the whole team on Thursday evening, nothing is too much trouble. I also used the spa which was incredible, a 60min massage, it's world class. Hermes toiletries are in your room and I also got a nice complimentary bottle of champagne sent up! This is The Best hotel in Amsterdam and they will make it feel like home from home.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “AMAZINGLY wonderful........”
Reviews.Author: Tracy006
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful weekend at The Grand, what a truly wonderful Hotel. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, and we received impeccable service. The Bridges restaurant, I have to mention, is one of the finest restaurants I have dined in, the ambience, the decor, the food and staff all were amazing, i haven't checked, but if this restaurant doesn't have a Michelin star it, definitely requires several. Food from Te Raw bar is a MUST to sample, and the bÃ©arnaise sauce is to die for, alongside the entrcote steak !!!!!! I have to stop writing, as it is making me salivate..... I haven't had a weekend in amsterdam for a long time, this place makes we want to go again, i think I may well have just found one of my favourite places on earth........ Also the beds!!!!!!!soft, warm, a wonderful turn down at night, with slippers and chocolates, seriously, you must visit this place.........

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive, but at a price!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as part of a business conference (conference was also at the hotel). There's really only one "downside" to this hotel and that is the price (if you are paying yourself). Non deal prices are quite hefty but I would still book here if I could get a small discount. The pro's: - it's slap bang in the middle of historic Amsterdam, actually on the edge of the red light district; 10min walk to central station (which has a train to Schiphol airport every 5/10 min) - it's a very well preserved historic building which has kept all its historic features but is beautifully renovated. The building is the prinsenhof, which has longstanding roots with the house of Orange (Dutch Royal family). The current Queen of Holland actually got married in this building - Rooms look beautiful with walk in showers and closets, art deco interior, very comfortable beds and a free nespresso coffee machine, free newspaper in the morning) - staff is well trained and ver attentative (only mishap on my visit is that my complementary newspaper wasn't there in the morning) - food at the hotel is solid, but nothing extremely special (but if you are in the centre of Amsterdam, there's plenty of good restaurants close by) In general it's a great hotel to stay. It looks new (no idea when they renovated it, but it can't be very long ago), is in a gerat location and is in a beautiful building. For business conferences it was definately a great hotel. If it would have been a personal trip, I would have still stuck to my review. Can you get better value for money in the same area? Yes! But sometimes it's worth to splash out and this one is worth it

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not for the price”
Reviews.Author: sandiUKLondon
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed in this hotel the last trip to Amsterdam, and I think they all raved about it. I could not understand how it was worth the cost of the rooms. We ended up getting a lot of money off due to a special, but considering the cost of these rooms on every other website, I just don't think its worth it. Maybe compared to the other hotels in the city, but then that's a sad state of affairs for Amsterdam. The room was TINY. So small. on the main level, so we had a street view which was nothing great, but it was not noisy which was nice. The beds were comfortable, as all Sofitel beds are, but I couldn't get over the smallness of the room FOR THE PRICE. I travel quite frequently in Europe and am aware of hotel size, but there was nothing here to be able to charge what they do. The lobby area is quite stunning, as is the bar in the hotel. The back courtyard is also quite nice on a sunny day. We had afternoon drinks in the courtyard when we realized we hadn't used up our drink vouchers. The area is good, not spectacular. I would not stay again unless I wasn't paying for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Short but brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: awesometraveller05
Reviews.Content: Brilliant, central hotel, very clean and good facilities. Very near bus-stop and boat-stop and amazing service Overall really amazing

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jodes244
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near it all, Central Station, Dam Square, The Red Light District and other key parts of town. Though close to everything, the hotel is quiet and tranquil. The rooms are modern and have all the amenities: Bose iPod docking station, towel warmer, Nespresso machine, etc. The beds are super comfy and the chocolate provided each nite was a nice treat. The only strange thing was we had two separate beds, rather than a king or queen. The concierge was helpful as were the other hotel staff. Niels was the best concierge and always provided great advice. We had breakfast each morning (included with our type of room rate) at Bridges, which was extensive and really good. If we go back to Amsterdam, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay and service was as good as expected with an hotel from this level. Looked good, felt good, was good. Especcially as platinum member, it felt good to be there. Only, the bill in the hotelbar was a bit (unexpted) high. But, was our own foult and worth it :-) Great!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDebs
Reviews.Content: Very chic hotel, very well-placed near the main tourist sites and with very warm and friendly service, which you normally don't get in places like this. The design of the hotel is modern, cool and very trendy. The restaurant is superlative but very pricey. We had a breakfast there too, very expensive but incredibly rich both in quantity and diversity of food. The rooms were to die for. We loved it and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only hotel to stay in when visiting Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ChesterNipper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights at the start of November 2011. The staff were wonderful, really helpful, friendly and couldn't do enough to help us. They parked my husband's beloved car in a safe location, hired us some bikes to potter about on and recommended a few night spots, which were fantastic. The hotel was luxurious, very nicely furnished and had a non stuffy atmosphere. We had a decent sized room overlooking the canal on the 1st floor, but it was really quiet and comfortable. However, the best things that make this hotel great, are the staff and its location. Would recommend it to tourists or business travellers, you definitely won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: brettnLis
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Sofitel Grand Amsterdam and can say it was one of the best hotel stays we have ever experienced. Once you enter the grounds of the hotel, the crazy outside world just disappears.... The hotel itself is stunning. On check in you are shown to your room and the features of the room & hotel are explained to you. The compliementary dried fruits & syrup biscuits are a lovely touch. The nespresso coffee machine was also appreciated! The central courtyard of the hotel is a oasis, the perfect place to enjoy a glass of champagne. We had dinner at the restaurant, the menu is fish based and we completely enjoy both the food and the amibence. All the staff we spoke with were outstanding. The staff are extremely friendly yet professional, a perfect balance. We can not reccommend a stay a this Grand Hotel strongly enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sf55
Reviews.Content: we have traveled extensively and were very impressed with the "grand" . Beautiful hotel, great location, friendly and efficient staff, would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: ukm2009freqtrav
Reviews.Content: From check-in we were treated like royalty and given a complimentary upgrade to a suite. As it was a special birthday, the hotel sent us some champagne and a lovely note. The rooms are truly luxurious with excellent quality bath products. In a city which is not known for very good service, the Sofitel stands out. You really won't want to leave the grounds! The only minor let down I had was Sunday service in the breakfast room - a bit chaotic. The Sofitel Luxembourg was previously my most favourite hotel in Europe but the Grand is now no 1!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Cracking”
Reviews.Author: jpargeter
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I've stayed at in ages. The location is fantastic - close proximity to the centre of town yet amazingly tranquil. You enter into a courtyard currently filled with arty mosaic-covered benches and chaise longues. The reception staff were not only helpful bit also very easy on the eye! We were upgraded to a suite, which only enhanced the experience. Beds were fantastically comfortable. The shower and bath were brilliant. The only comment would be that some of the technology could do with some TLC.. the TV in the bath didn't work.. The concierge were fantastic. At very short notice they were able to conjure up a table at one of Amsterdam's popular bistro and cocktail bars without any fuss whatsoever. The bar, spa and restaurant (for breakfast) were up to scratch. Overall, this is a five star hotel that doesn't compromise and certainly lives up to the expectations of the Sofitel brand. If you're looking to treat a partner or celebrate a special event, I'd recommend a stay at The Grand.

Reviews.Title: “helpful concierge”
Reviews.Author: Nirai
Reviews.Content: thumbs up for the concierge staff. they gave good restaurant recommendation and very helpful indeed. good location too.

Reviews.Title: “If I had only one month to live, I would spend it at The Grand”
Reviews.Author: JCG098
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip to the Sofitel six months in advance for a Luxury Room. When I checked in at the Hotel, they could not find my reservation so I showed them my confirmation number. They told me they didn't have any Luxury Rooms available, so they had to put me in an Opera Suite. This was a HUGE upgrade; I had a living room and a dining area and it was completely first class. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The bathroom was immaculate. The staff treated me like a king. They met exceeded my expectations for every request I made. The restaurant had incredible oysters on the half shell which were native to The Netherlands. The atmosphere is magical, you feel like you are in a different world. I felt like everything was in slow motion, time stopped. I was treated like royalty. I coming back whenver I get the chance. I am going to upload my pictures of the hotel later.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in A'dam”
Reviews.Author: OllieOreo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the top hotels in Amsterdam and this is def. one of them! The location is good but it all depends on what you are doing in Amsterdam. Its very close to the red light district which can be a bit annoying if you are not into that because you will easily cross the red light district when walking around... Lobby is quite dark but the rooms are light and the bed are SUPER comfortable! Bed and Breakfast! This is not an B&B but its the best par of the hotel! The bed & the breakfast! Breakfast is really really good with a huge selection of fruit and FRESH juice! Also I think the restaurant has a michelin star or use to have, very good! Reason why I dont give the hotel 5 stars is value, Its very expensive and its not that good! I have a few hotels in Amsterdam I prefer over this.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: voyagevoyage40
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and this is one of the best hotel in the world. Everything is perfect, staff, service and room. Location is just amazing, walking distance to a lot of major tourist destination. As an Accor card member, this is one on the only hotel where the card was recognized and acknowledge. Well do not hesitate, if you go to Amsterdam this is the place you want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FScfs
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in Amsterdam. This is a truly Grand hotel. It is within an easy walk from Centraal Station. 2 blocks to the Dam Square, many museums are walkable, the Anne Frank House and the Flower Market are also walkable. Bridges Restaurant within the hotel is excellent, particularly for seafood. They have a good wine list which includes a few selections from Holland as well. The central courtyard is delightful in warm months for dining or a drink. The lobby bar area is quiet, relaxing and has good selection of single malts.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! I could live there.”
Reviews.Author: Titamxnl
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and stay in lots of hotels for fun and work. This hotel is amazing! I always pay attention to the service and here I was amazed. It was a dream! Please note that The Netherlands is a country were generally the client is almost never first even if you spend considerable amounts of money, i.e., Metz & Co in Amsterdam - worst client service ever. Don't bother to visit. So with that said that this hotel makes yout stay lovely!! The staff puts attention to every detail. Everybody is friendly, attentive and food and quality are great. Loved room service and I was amazed by the service at the restaurant too. They have delicious sea food. During our stay, We got three times drinks from the house. We got upgraded so we stayed the first night in a suite and it was perfect! Living room, dinning room. Big bathroom and lovely room with walk in closet. We can't complain at all. We couldn't leave the hotel after the great expirience. And we literally didn't leave the hotel since we went from room to great restaurant and bar and then decided to stay another night. This time we got a normal room and still we enjoyed it very much. Thanks to the good attitude of staff. This hotel is well located since its in the middle of the center and still gives you the relax feeling. If you want to make use of the spa book it in advance because it could be very busy. It is quite expensive but it's more than worth it. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Paulmat555
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and amenities, the lounge is amazing, so was the brakfast. Located in close proximity to the red light area and coffee shops.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid, historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: PSeib Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to the center of things but flanked by two quiet canals, Sofitel The Grand Amsterdam provides an excellent base for tourist or business traveler. The former Amsterdam city hall has become a luxurious hotel with an excellent seafood restaurant. It is an easy ten-minute walk from the train station and all the principal tourist stops are likewise easily accessible. The service is excellent, the rooms plush.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Claude_Ray
Reviews.Content: I have stayed two nights in a superior room at the Sofitel. I must say it is not as nice as other Sofitel. The room although 2 levels above Classic room is rather small and furnished ok, and not upscale. The first room that was assigned stunk chemical mized with smoke odors. I was changed for another room without much problem. I did not like the low pressure shower head and the price ( circa EUR 30-35) of the breakfast. The restaurant is not well lighted and the food is ok but not worth EUR30. I liked the location and the pool. In general, l think the room was overpriced (360/night) and the service good but not like with the other Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of tranquility in a hectic A'dam”
Reviews.Author: RafaelRedczus
Reviews.Content: Wonderful old building with a lot of cozy corners (old palace), great decorations (beautiful fresh flowers everywhere) with a mixture between classis and modern (award winning), very friendly service, central location (3 min. walk from the Dam), small but nice spa

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, lovely historical building”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel were good. Stayed here twice for six nights total over a two week period. The front desk staff were endearing, one let me check in at 7 am in the morning after a 12 hour flight, the other remembered my name as soon as I walked in the second time (impressed as this is not exactly a boutique hotel).Â  Location was very good, Â an easy walk everywhere whether to the shops, restaurants (ie Envy, Casa di David) or to the museums, and just down the street from Dam Square. Â Also the tram system is easy to use. Â Despite being in such a convenient location, there was minimal noise once in the hotel, just good old plain silence once back in room. Â Â  As is often the case in this part of Europe, the Â rooms were quite tiny, the first room I stayed in was slightly wider with two twin beds pushed together, the second room with a queen sized bed took up most of the space, there was a minature sofa and a small desk. Â I liked the bathroom more, it had a cheerful Â white/beige color tone, with heated towel racks, a shower space with super hot water (essential after walking around all day in the cold windy rain) and Hermes toiletries. Â  The gym was also small with one treadmill, two bikes and one elliptical. Â  Â The bar at bridges was beautifully designed, a welcoming haven (again after a long day walking in the cold rain), I didn't get a chance to eat at Bridges but it is a good looking restaurant. Â  I liked the fact wifi was free (or you could pay for higher speed at â‚¬17 a day.) Â The well designed and welcoming "library" in the lobby also had state of the art Apple computers, a convenient place to buy and print your museum tickets in advance. Â  Room for minor improvement: ~ room temperature was hard to control. Â There were times I'd like to have fresh air but the windows would not open. Also there were times the room was cold but the only working heat came from the towels rack, as the one by the window didn't work ~ housekeeping related: left my room at 11 amÂ one day, came back at 430 pm & room was being serviced, so returned after a drink at the bar & realized laundry did not get picked up, instead of shampoo and conditioner in shower was given shampoo and lotion, the water bottles were not replenished (happened more than once), then at 9 pm got a call from housekeeping asking if the laundry was mine as she got "confused" which room they belonged to. ... Sigh....

Reviews.Title: “I had a grand time!”
Reviews.Author: DramaQueenFlip
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 7 and we stayed at The Grand from September 30 to October 3. The brick exterior was beautiful and the modern lobby was a good contrast to it. Check in was a breeze and guest relations manager Zsa Zsa even escorted us to our room. She was most friendly and helpful. Everyday before and after dinner we would enjoy drinks at the terrace, in the courtyard formed by the hotel's different buildings that were connected together. The staff at the terrace were friendly and very efficient. The concierge staff were also very efficient and helpful in terms of providing dinner reservations and transport services. The entire staff, from the restaurant to housekeeping to the doormen were the epitome of gracious, hospitable and efficient service. The bed in our room was so comfortable, if Amsterdam wasn't such an exciting city it might have been doubly difficult to get out of bed in the mornings. Breakfast was always delicious and had a good variety to choose from. The hotel was located only 5 minutes away from the red light district. We also booked a private dinner cruise and we were picked up by the skipper at the hotel's front door. The company's name is Belle Epoque and they served a 3-course dinner where each course was obtained from gourmet restaurants. From starter to dessert, it was well worth it! The skipper and her assistant were a joy to cruise with. I love Amsterdam and I love The Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel - must stay”
Reviews.Author: 2809GPL
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful staff. Stayed one night for business and had excellent, relaxing stay. Staff couldn't help enough and breakfast was outstanding. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: alex m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my wife, before a business trip to Germany. The location is perfect, everything is close to walk distance. The staff was Ok, just a few confused during my check-in, but everybody were gentle and polite. The room was a charm! There is a restaurant in the hotel (The Bridges) with a wonderful food, excellent staff and a good price. Definitely we recommend the Sofitel Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel fab restaurant but female staff a bit stepford wivesExpensive”
Reviews.Author: Lizzyfa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is central for walking around Amsterdam and is really comfortable we had a great bar meal one night and fantastic meal in the restaurant ..the best halibut I have ever had .I also liked the spa pool very quiet and a place for a peaceful swim The barman in the brown bar was also great . I did not however think the breakfasts were that good especially the cooked bacon and dggs ..with Stepford wives type waitress staff who were very polite but did not listen to what was asked for ..one welcomed a guest in front with "welcome to France " err what ? .I also hated the fact that staff repeatedly knocked or came into the room making all kinds of excuses , particularly on the morning we were trying to pack and get ready to leave.. just leave guests in peace

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience/will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing. They overlook nothing, down to the smallest detail such as Hermes bath products!! Check-in was a breeze. The concierge and front desk staff were super friendly and very helpful. The hotel itself, like the city has a long history going back as far as A 14th century convent. The room was very comfortable and particularly well designed. The room resembled a loft apartment. We enjoyed High Tea in the library because it was raining out and this was a fun experience. The entire staff is just very well trained and attentive. The hotel is centrally located in the most perfect location(in my opinon). Just a block walk from great food, Coffeeshops, girls in the window(if that is your thing, I was there with my girlfriend), The best parts of the Canal rings etc. Our room had a view of the canal and was very nice. The rooms were cleaned several times a day. Additionally, when we left the hotel in July, I left my flip video camera in the room. I realized this in September and after contacting the hotel, their security officer Mr. Crama gave me quick correspondence, located the camera and shipped the item free of charge. That is very rare, but not surprising for such an amazing establishment! I have stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels worldwide and with all honesty, this is my favorite. I will never stay in another hotel when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotels ...”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid75
Reviews.Content: This is a truly great hotel. The decor is really cool, the beds are superbly comfortable, the bathrooms excellent, the food is wonderful. But what makes a great hotel is the staff. I've stayed here twice this year. The first time I was really busy with work and was working at the business centre even after I'd checked out. One of the staff noticed that I'd been beavering away at my laptop for quite a long and asked whether she could bring me a drink. She then brought me a beautiful pot of tea (and I do mean the teapot was very beautiful, but it was also a very touching gesture). When I returned more recently, the person checking me in mentioned that on the previous visit I'd had a problem with room service (it was simply that because I was working I wanted to have dinner in my room and there did not seem to be a room service menu in the room, when I rang room service, one was delivered to my room very promptly) and that problem had been addressed and there were now room service menus in the room. That is really impressive service and excellent follow up by the staff. As much as I love Amsterdam, I will return simply to stay at the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “somthing else”
Reviews.Author: john a
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel near the canals of amsterdam. nice historic building. great servise and great rooms with comforteble beds . good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: beefeater34
Reviews.Content: Booked room type (deluxe king) not available "due to construction" but only found out when we got to the room. Large cobweb in the room and stained grouting in shower area. Room service order delivered incorrectly. 7am alarm call received, waking us up, which we'd not requested! The hotel is in a very good location but so are many less expensive ones! Sofitel are off my list - this is meant to be one of their best and it's really not that good.

Reviews.Title: “1.40m beds in doubles for a 5*hotel... I guess not!?”
Reviews.Author: MilesandMore123
Reviews.Content: Lets start with what I liked: -very nice decor and atmosphere. -very nice breakfast -very good concierge service -on average nice and friendly staff -rent of bikes and motorcycles on site -the cosy atmosphere of the pool -the fact that the managerial staff came twice gently to apologize about the bed issue What I disliked: -size of the double beds in superior rooms, 1.40M is a SCANDAL for a 5 stars hotel!!! -when mentioning the bed problem to the check-in counter the fact they lied to me and claimed there were no bigger beds in that category.... funny to see later the room of a friend with a normal king size bed! -not enough machines in the gym -I had to wait 10min in the breakfast room before somebody finally took care of us, took another 5 minutes for our table to be cleaned and setup. -the fact that the Sofitel site, who claimed they have the lowest rate and/or to adapt, even grant a reduction of 10% if a lower rate is found with same conditions, refused to do so, although I've send them all the proofs/documents!? Would I go back there!? I believe I would, should I manage to get a good deal, as I really liked the decor, and the atmosphere but not without the assurance they give me a room with a normal bed!

Reviews.Title: “A Gracious Staff Surround by a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BRNR
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeds the beauty of the canals of Amsterdam and its own historical building with its superb staff. We have traveled extensively throughout the world staying in many 5 star hotels, and have had the "butler" experience before: the guy who shows up in tails to shake your hand who you rarely see again. This hotel's butler service is honestly a butler service. We had as our butlers Bart and Luis. They were extremely helpful in terms of sharing their knowledge of the city, making reservations, assuring that your room was to your satistaction, noting your individual likes and dislikes, even down to personally delivering your room service order, inquiring if your would like them to pack or unpack your bags, etc. Bottom line, their service was so exquisite, you hated to leave the hotel. The hotel itself is beautifully appointed and very conveniently located. They are right on one of the canals. Walk in one direction and you have great pubs or cafes as they called them. Walk in the other and you get a first hand look at the red light district. Their breakfast is not to be missed and do not leave without eating their waffles. These are not your normal fabulous waffle. These are small pieces of indescribable heaven on your plate. We were on day one of our stay and already planning when we could return. You will feel at home and welcome in the beauty that is the Sofitel The Grand Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SusanGrogan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on a Sunday in September to celebrate our wedding anniversary. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left the service was excellent. The hotel delivered a complimentary bottle of champage to our room which was well received! The room was great and the bed very comfortable. The hotel breakfast was delicious. I read some reports that the breakfast area can get over crowded but it absolutely fine for us, however it wasn't a weekend. The location is ideal too. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here as the service is outstanding and the best we had on our trip”
Reviews.Author: jean_mar_10
Reviews.Content: This is a great value,the staff are warm and welcoming,the rooms are wonderfully well-equipped,the breakfast is excellent,the location is perfect and the whole hotel is spotless. Everything was great, they had free wifi,a balcony,laundry service,breakfast included,and they were happy to help with whatever we needed.The hotel itself was very clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Hope B
Reviews.Content: I can't fully explain how much we loved this hotel. After our long flight overseas, the train ride into the city and carting our luggage through the streets of Amsterdam... to be welcomed at The Grand was the best. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite, with a beautiful view over a quite canal. The room was stunning. I love the style and detail of everything at the hotel. The staff was beyond gracious! We had dinner one evening at the restaurant, Bridges.... it too was wonderful. The location is great, close to Dam square. The concierge provided wonderful recommendations for other restaurants. We were delayed returning to the states for two nights at the end of our trip, because of the hurricane that hit New York. We immediately called and booked at The Grand. It was like a mini-return home....after having been traveling for three weeks. I really can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel! I will recommend it to anyone I know going to Amsterdam! It is spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: greynomad16
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 2 nights in a junior suite which overlooked the canal. We had a third bed in a twin room. The extra bed was very comfortable but it left only a small amount of space in the room. The room was really only big enough for twin beds. The hotel was clean and in a good location to easily walk to Dam Square. Would have liked more time to explore Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “This one gets a 4.5”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Sofitel New York a few times, and it's one of my favorite hotels. So I thought I'd give this one a go. Overall, we liked it a lot. It's in a large, historic, very interesting building -- they have a guided tour that unfortunately we didn't have time to do. Our luxury room wasn't overly spacious but not oppressively small either. The bathroom, with tub and separate rainshower, was modern and sleek and looked like it had been recently renovated. We requested a canal-side room and that's what we got. Dinner at Bridges restaurant, which specializes in seafood, was outstanding (but I would have liked more vegetables please!) I wavered between giving this a 4 and a 5 for a number of (probably overly picky) reasons. But here goes. Breakfast was included in our rate. It's served buffet style, and there are also some cooked items that you can order separately. I've rarely found a hotel that does this well. Because guests serve themselves, and the staff are constantly having to clear tables, take orders, and replenish the buffet items, the result is chaos. I had to keep dodging staff who were walking briskly, loaded down with dishes. If you want to order something from the a la carte menu, you have to flag down one of the waiting staff, and this can be hard when the restaurant is busy. One morning, the main restaurant was full, so we were directed to the overflow room on the other side of the hotel. It was a nice room and actually quieter. But they ran out of some items that took a while to replenish. The hotel has a swimming pool as well as sauna and steam room, which is all very nice. But there's nowhere to lounge around the pool. So apparently the idea is that you swim, maybe go into the sauna or steam room, then leave. Which is not as relaxing as it could be. The hotel is on the border of the red light district, which is seedy in a safe sort of way. If you turn right when leaving the hotel, you're in the Amsterdam of a thousand bachelor parties; turn left and there isn't a single brothel in sight. I think this was okay for one night, but three nights of it was a bit much for me. The fact that you enter the hotel through a courtyard gives you the sense that you've left that all behind. But even so, next time I may try a hotel in a less risque part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you the Grand,our 14th Wedding Anniversary we will never forget.”
Reviews.Author: FALLINGWATERS6700
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip from Amsterdam, where we stayed at this wonderful hotel, from the moment we entered the beautiful court yard we were treated exceptionally well. We were upgraded to a suite which was a wonderful surprise of which we thoroughly enjoyed. The staff here make your stay perfect nothing is to much trouble. The hotel surroundings are sumptuous and everywhere is immaculately clean. The breakfast is wonderful with a buffet and hot breakfast and champagne included. If you want somewhere extra special with great customer service and very central this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kitty064
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very central but quiet. Fantastic beds Great internal courtyard garden, perfect for balmy summer evenings. And on cooler evenings, they can give you blankets!

Reviews.Title: “Just prefect!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessJumper
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of days at the Grand with some colleagues preparing for a big meeting and it was just awesome. Rooms were great, service perfect, great vibe, fantastic restaurant, extremely central location - particularly if you want to see the - shall we say - real Amsterdam. I can highly recommend it if you have the cash. It's worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Selayzim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about feeling good. For start you are in the heart of Amsterdam, close to the major atractions. The rooms are very confortable and the toilet was one of the nicier I ever seen, I really enjoyed the dark atmosphere on it. I will not keep longer, just like to say that is probably one of the best hotels in Amsterdam with a reasonable price for what it offers and you wil feel like a king after coming back from a fun night in Amsterdam to rest in this luxury Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you can... Do it!”
Reviews.Author: abu-noah
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many gorgeous hotels in the past, but this one beats most of them on many grounds: 1) it's in amsterdam! Old Europe, home of tiny houses, cramped hotel rooms, dark hallways.. Yet the grand is, well... Grand... Spacious, luxurious, airy, light.... The courtyard is gorgeous, the garden is peaceful, and the room was beautiful. 2) the service is something I had not had for a long time in Europe. I am not saying that european service is bad... No, just that Asian and middle eastern (read, dubai) service is just better... Well, the grand was definitely at par, with dubai... Except that it felt geniun...so actually better than dubai 3) location location location: perfect! 4) price: steep. But then again it's the Grand... If you can afford it, if u can smuggle it during a business trip... Do it!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAM5000
Reviews.Content: A classic old world style hotel. Although only a block from the red light district, it felt worlds apart. Enter through a grand courtyard. The hotel was beautiful. Rooms were small but not tiny. Excellent furnishings. Rooms on back canal can be loud, especially when trash is collected. Staff was very good with suggestions and help. Loved the spa area. Nice indoor pool and workout area, though it needs more seating area at pool. Rooms are not as expensive as they could be, but everything at hotel is pricey. We skipped the overpriced breakfast buffet and ate down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OregonStateTravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Grand Sofitel in Amsterdam on the nights of June 4, 5 and 6 in suite 336. Two other couples in our traveling party also stayed at The Grand on the same nights at our recommendation. WE ALL HAD A VERY ENJOYABLE STAY. From my first contact with Sanne Pisters in reservations to the last contact with the concierge as we all left for the airport our stay WAS PERFECT. You have a wonderful property. I own the Ocean Lodge and The Lodges at Cannon Beach in Cannon Beach, Oregon a beachside town located 90 minutes west of Portland Oregon so I know good service when I see it. Your rooms were clean and well appointed. Everything worked properly and was explained by the valet. Your morning breakfast buffet was very complete including the hot entrees we ordered after getting fruit and pastry. The Grand is a wonderful spot to stay because it is central to all of the activities we planned. Once day four in our group went to the train station and rented bikes to ride the dikes across the river, two others walked to the Zoo. Others went to the Anne Frank House, on canal tours and to museums. At the end of each day we met back at The Grand for a quiet moment of respite. We enjoyed two late evenings outside in the terrace bar and one room service when one of our party twisted a knee and needed a night off from walking. Your concierge selected perfect places for us to eat where they clearly knew we were Sofitel guests. Each night we had a nice hot shower and then fell asleep in the wonderful beds - ready for a new day, All of your employees made us feel at home and we will be returning to The Grand when we take a cruise from Amsterdam to Basel, Switzerland.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: xinki
Reviews.Content: Sofitel's renowned service in addition to Dutch hospitality have made our stay at this hotel a wonderful experience. The contrast of modern furnishing in a historical building dating back to the 1500s makes this hotel ideal for a romantic getaway. The guest relations manager greeted us from the lobby and escorted us to the room. The entire staff were eager to please us. The guest-staff get together on thursdays with flowing champagne glasses and finger foods is just one example of the warmth and hospitality you'll expect. Dam square is right across the corner and the red light district is a five minute walk away, making its location ideal regardless of what your idea of fun is. The beds were extremely comfortable and the view of the canal from the room was just perfect. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone and I would definitely stay there if I ever go to Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: JenM72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about 10 days in July. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were normal size for European standards, with a nice bathroom and good range of Hermes ammenities (though for me, they felt more a scent men would prefer than women). Bed was softer than I am normally use to, but comfortable none the less. Use the free "low speed" internet in my room, which met all my needs e.g. could still do skype video chats etc. My room faced the inner courtyard, so was very quiet. Breakfast is very good, but you have to order hot food (so if you are in a rush, order it as soon as you step inside). Hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the main train station, and just on the edge of the red light district and shoppin area. So you are not in the middle of any, but only a stones throw away, which made the hotel very suitabel for me (ie all the convenience without the noise, but again I had a inner courtyard viewing room). lastly, there is a gym, but it is very small with just a few cardio machines and some weights and one other machine. Only 2 small negatives were , the room rate is not cheap for those on a budget, and the lift if you need it is al little slow. All in all, a great hotel, good location, nice rooms, and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Won't come back again”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this hotel 10 months ago, and decided to stay here again. When we first arrived it was all good and we were greeted by a very helpful guest relations manager and shown to our room. The experience turned for the worst the night morning when we went for breakfast the next morning. Understandably it was a Sunday morning at 9.30am so it was packed full. The restaurant is composed of mainly a few large square tables of 8 which means you have to share your breakfast table with 2-3 other groups of guests if the restaurant is full. Otherwise you wait until a table is free - could have been at least half hour. Not a very nice "first thing in the morning experience" to share a table with strangers, especially when breakfast costs â‚¬33 per person. Service was slow at breakfast and we were not even served our coffees until we had almost finished breakfast. We also had to flag down staff to order our coffees and hot food. Again for â‚¬66 this has to be the worst and most expensive breakfast ever. We were in our room getting ready to check out before 12pm and we had 2 staff ring our bell wanting to get in the room. It was really disruptive as we obviously had not checked out so room could not be cleaned yet. Not sure if this is their way of scooting guests out of the hotel. When we went down to the lobby to check out, there was one long queue of about 5 groups of people waiting to be served by 2 staff. I got in line but when I got to the front of the queue another line had formed behind the desk of the second staff - effectively pushing in. The staff paid no attention and just served whoever was in front of her desk. This has got to be the worst service on check-out I've ever had. I must have waited for 15 minutes but people who pushed in did not even had to wait 2 minutes. The arrangement at reception should be made more clear to avoid misunderstandings. Even though the hotel bill had a â‚¬50 charge for overnight parking the front desk staff asked if I needed transport. Mmmm... There were some exceptional staff at this hotel but it's typical Sofitel which I have found really is a Novotel that is better designed and decorated with designer toiletries, better bedding and a fancy restaurant and bar. Attitude is the same as any other mass market hotel chain mentality. As we were dragging our bags out to the car, the front door staff just watched us and only offered to help when we were moving our last one, which was really funny. There is no bath in the superior rooms but shower only. The shower head had very poor low pressure even though it was about 20cm wide. The rooms facing the front can be noisy as well. Overall it's a nice hotel on the outside but they need to improve on the "software". They also opened a spa and swimming pool on the 1st floor since the first time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “What an amzing hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonha8
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing time in Amsterdam and the hotel was the best we have stayed in, everyone was so helpful with such comfortable room & beds, my wife loved the way when we came back from our evening out to find our curtains had been closed :-) . we would deffinatly stay again. Loved the pancakes at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect antidote to the weather...”
Reviews.Author: kitkat1717
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam can be a bit rainy, which is to be expected, but on one of our days it was absolutely torrential all day. This is the perfect hotel to be as we never had to leave. we ventured out into the cold and rain for a bit, but came back to a spa visit and a little time in the sauna to warm up. Service here is definitely first rate, Gabrielle went out of our way upon check in (room was not ready) - but we had an upgrade to a junior suite and their IT person came by while we were waiting and hooked up our internet. From making dinner reservations to ensuring all our needs were met, this hotel met all of our needs. Central location and very easy to navigate from there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Grand”
Reviews.Author: billyboy18
Reviews.Content: First off, the location cannot be beat. While it is a block off hte Red Light District, it is like a little oasis--very quiet and relaxing. I would recommend you opt for a canal view room as it is just beautiful viewing the canal, especially in the middle of the night. The price was reasonable for a 5 star hotel. The room was comfortable if a bit tight. The bathroom was narrow and a bit weird. The hotel restaurant (Bridges) was just ok--a bit pretentious and overpriced--but the breakfast buffet excellent at 33 Euros. The pool was small and changing rooms tight but nice to have. Check in easy, nice outdoor courtyard and small bar. Coffee shop Greenhouse down the block with a friendly mix of folks. All in all, a great experience with a few minor flaws.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaclh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Sofitel, which is in a very lovely building with warm, welcoming and attentive staff. Everything is done to ensure that their guests feel comfortable. Breakfast is a sumptuous affair - probably one of the best I have had anywhere. So good in fact that we just lingered for much longer than we would normally do over breakfast. Ours was a ' superior ' room and whilst being very comfortable, was quite compact. The pool is calm and peaceful and very welcome after a busy sight seeing day. The location of the hotel is perfect as most important locations are within walking distance (or borrow/hire bicycles from the hotel). The only thing that would have made the stay perfect was if our bed could have been made properly, without any creases in the too large quilt cover for the quilt, & if the bottom sheet had been properly laid on the mattress so it could be firmly tucked in. I had to remake the bed on our first 2 nights & yes I could have called someone to do it, but we were ready for bed & had already got in to go to sleep, so it was just quicker & easier to do it myself. I told reception about it after the 2nd night & certainly it was better on the 3rd night, but I still had to readjust the (now better fitting) quilt cover to get rid of the creases on the underside of the quilt. It is really not difficult to make a bed and in a hotel like this it should be perfect. Once the bedding was properly in place, we slept really well as the beds are very comfortable. So overall, if you get a maid who can make a bed you will have a lovely time in this hotel. If I knew I wouldn't have to make my bed I would be happy to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay - wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: rc127
Reviews.Content: Sofitel The Grand was our second stop on a 4 stop honeymoon. The hotel gave us a complimentary upgrade and champagne to celebrate the occasion. Aside from the upgrade, the staff was extremely warm and welcoming upon check-in. They escorted us to our beautiful room which overlooked the courtyard and walked us through all of the features of the hotel room. The room was well decorated and very clean. The bathroom was amazing, with a dual head shower, a large soaking tub and his and hers sinks. Also, the location of the hotel itself was great as we were within walking distance of the city center. We both used the gym, swimming pool and steam room (all complimentary) during our stay. While the gym was definitely tiny, the indoor pool was a decent size. The conciergeâ€™s recommendations were all a hit from Pancake Bakery, to a new Vietnamese restaurant, to a great wine bar. Even though the weather wasnâ€™t ideal (pockets of rain the whole weekend) our trip was excellent because of Sofitel The Grand. We will definitely be back and wouldnâ€™t think of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had dinner in the restaurant and the food was just perfect. What a beautiful atmosphere and nice people. We stayed in a Prestige Suite (124) and the room was very, very nice. Could not be better. Very spacious and clean. The service we had was outstanding, especially at Reception and Guest Relations, beautiful and very kind ladies!! We defenitely are going back to the Grand. What an amazing hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: rj_watters
Reviews.Content: Service second to none, we have stayed here before and was well worth going back, and will use this hotel in the future, friendly staff, in the middle of the town easy access to night life etc.

Reviews.Title: “exqusite accomodation in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: aurorasev
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 days in May 2011 within walking distance of the central train station as well as the Dam area it is an oasis in the busy and touristy area The architecture and interior decoration is truly exquisite, there is a large flower filled courtyard to relax in, and the staff are very professional and helpful

Reviews.Title: “great hotel! it made our trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: mohkh
Reviews.Content: i visited this hotel with my girlfriend on June 2nd for 3 days and had a great great time! they upgraded us to the William suite and offered great service all around , i specially want to thank Mauricio and Domingo who were our butlers and were of great assistance , i cannot recommend this hotel enough , if you want to visit Amsterdam and want a genuine 5 star experience look no further. other perks are great location, and the best in room dining you can ever taste! try there daily chocolate dessert and the 4 cheese pizza! to top it all of they have a horse carriage downstairs that can take you anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, amazing, renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Chris015
