Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Grand and stayed in one of their newly renovated apartments, truly amazing with its oversize living-room (complimentary nespresso machine included) and bathroom (best shower ever) and its quiet, comfortable bedroom. Nice view on a small canal (sleepy swans drifting slowly at night, their neck twisted back to rest their head on their feathers, a sight to be seen). I stayed in this hotel 5-6 years ago and it looks so much better now : I remember a very outdated decoration in the bedroom but everything looks fresh now. There were beautiful pink and violet tulips everywhere in the hotel, it was gorgeous. The breakfast room is impressive, not to be missed. Breakfast itself is good although not as good as Sofitel London or Berlin. The food at the restaurant was good, not amazing, and the service a bit slow although restaurant was only half full. Location is very good, red light district very close but you wouldn't believe it, there was absolutely no nuisance from it. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend - first visit to Amsterdam so played safe with the Sofitel. Great staff, great welcome, beautiful room with some very original features. A Krups Nespressomachine was a welcome find, as was the excellent shower. The bed was probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in, and although it's a noisy town, the bedroom was completely insulated and the windows overlooked a quieter canal behind the hotel. Almost didn't want to go out...

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have been lucky and stayed in some great hotels over the years but our recent stay Sofitel The Grand was one of the best. From the moment we arrived the staff could not have done more to help every single person was excellent and really cared about making a difference to our stay. They fused over our little boy and made him feel welcome which is not always the reaction in hotels. The room was superb, big and comfortable with a great bathroom. Swimming pool was great and food both in room and in Bridges was great. Although not the cheapest hotel it was money well spent and good value. Would definitely recommend to anyone. It really is one of the best hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A mediocre hotel without attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: aj005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a few nights at the end of May 2011. What seemed to be nice upon arrival, turned out to be less than pleasant later.... Pluses: + location Minuses: - canal view room - very loud at night (people coming back from parties), at dawn and early in the morning (trash trucks) - the door bell did not work in the room, so a few times per day, different staff members would enter the room unexpectedly without knocking on the door - the light bulb in the bathroom did not work for the whole stay - no one bothered to fix it for 3 days - dog's poo in the pool, the cleaning lady said "I cannot swim, so my friend will come soon and take it out", next day there was just a little mark on the wall after fishing it out.... - a prebooked gift package that never arrived - I did approach the floor manager before checking-out and informed her about all of the above - she suggested a fruit cocktail..... In summary, certainly not a five-star hotel. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convention/meeting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanZ07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel April 30- May 2. We got to the hotel at noon; check-in was 3 PM. Front desk finally gave us a room at 4:30 PM. The room they provided was on two levels Bed on lower level and bath and closet up 5 steps. Very challenging to maneuver around and use toilet at night. We spoke to many people and a lot of them got stuck with this type of room. Breakfast was included and dining room was disorganized. You had to hail servers to get tea, coffee or hot food. Cold food was buffet. Quality was good but a pain to constantly get someone to bring hot items. This is a big hotel in an old building which could not be renovated sufficiently to keep old world charm with modern conveniences. The service in this hotel is poor, the rates high and they are disorganized. My wife and I are from USA and a fellow guest from Germany commented about the many quality problems at this hotel. I would avoid this hotel even if they offered a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt or hesitation the best hotel in town...”
Reviews.Author: dutchboy81
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the only and I mean only negative thing to this hotel... They will say "Bonjour" wherever you are, reception, bar, restaurant and even housekeeping says it! I questioned this when I stayed at the Sofitel in Budapest last year and they explained that as Sofitel is the top brand within the Accor (French) hotel chain, this is therefore an instruction they receive from their head office in Paris to welcome all clients with the French Bonjour... But of course do it when you know a guest is French but when I stay at the NH Barbizon Palace I will not be greeted with a "Buenos dias" referring to their Spanish heritage. (I think it is clear from the above that France will never be my chosen holiday destination lol) But too many lines spend already on the the bad, back to the REALLY good: - Location = 10 minutes from Central Station - In red light district but as soon as you enter their courtyard, you honestly wouldnÂ´t know! (Red light district is traditionally one of the safest areas of Amsterdam due to huge police presence) - This hotel is pure luxury but at the same time VERY suitable for people that can afford luxury hotels but donÂ´t want the snobbish part of it. (eg Ritz London, Four Seasons George V Paris etc) This really does not mean though that this is not a top hotel, but it just feels naturally chilled. The staff have a uniform that does not involve ties but still look EXTREMELY smart so again not sure who came up with the idea but TOPCLASS. Upon arrival we were greeted by the doorman who took care of our luggage and brought us to reception where the very friendly Front desk staff checked us in quick and we were taken to our room by a member of staff. the luggage at that point had already arrived there. The rooms were immaculately clean and spacious and while it may seem strange, but I was travelling with a female colleague and the room she was given was really a feminine room with soft tones and just girly chairs etc, while mine was with open brick work, hence giving it a more masculine feeling. Really liked this touch but not sure if it was done on purpose or if this was pure coincidence but nevertheless nice. In the room there were 2 apples on a plate which were really juicy and nice. Also the turn down service is just nice but naturally is expected from a real 5 star but again the little chocolate was delicious. The bathrooms we had were with walk-in shower only but apparently this is with all the base rooms and from the luxury rooms onwards the rooms come with bath. For me this was not a problem and think most business people would not waste their time in a bath tub anyway. The room was also equipped with a Krupps coffee machine and a dvd player. The beds... oh the beds... WestinÂ´s heavenly and Marriott beds are nice and comfy but I never had a problem getting up, here however 3 mornings in a row I overslept!!! Eventhough I got my wake up calls and my phone alarm snoozed me twice I was almost late for my meetings 3 times... So due to the above I only managed breakfast once, which was a shame as it was really diverse and plentiful. Again the staff amazing with eye for detail, if my cup as not even half full it was topped up again so really really EXCELLENT! Large selection of cheeses, meats and juices and a large hot buffet too. Anyway, I have stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam but this by far tops them all. As for the people that call this hotel expensive, yes there are 5 star hotels in town that are cheaper (NH Grand Krasnapolsky, Marriott, Renaissance etc) but for me these hotels are not the real 5 star hotels of Amsterdam. (and comparing the rates of Sofitel to the Pulitzer, Dylan, De LÂ´Europe or the Amstel Intercontinental, I found their rates to generally either match or are better but maybe I have been lucky. lol) Anyway to finish off, if you have the chance: You cannot go wrong here, definitely recommend this place for a good night sleep and top class experience!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it...”
Reviews.Author: Boyds_TSB
Reviews.Content: A beautiful Hotel from start to finish. Lovely room overlooking the canal, fantastic bed!...so comfortable. Excellent service. All in all a great place to stay - will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: jfdx Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay in the heart of Amsterdam! The restaurant serves amazing seafood, the bar is cosy and opens on a intimate garden. Service is elegant and friendly. There is a fireplace room next to the lobby where it is nice to relax and have a drink after walking around Amsterdam. We'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendley, central”
Reviews.Author: tedsca
Reviews.Content: Stopped there for 3 nights and was very well looked after. food and service is fantastic!! It is in the centre of amsterdam turn right out the hotel and your in the red light district, but you wouldnt know from inside the hotel. turn left out the hotel if you want to avoid the red light area. Anyone put off by this should reconsider visiting the city as you will stumble unplanned into the red light area where ever you stay. Loverly building (where the queen got married), fantastic staff, swimming pool, gym all things considered you must stop there

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5-star”
Reviews.Author: brittripper
Reviews.Content: Strange hotel. Charming staff but rather naff decoration, a bit like mid-range Ikea circa 1995. When this hotel was Sofitelled it probably looked quite trendy - for about a year. Now it is horribly dated and just a bit too expensive. Why do Sofitel have to try to be "modern" when country house classic would not have dated nearly so fast? Our room was pretty hideous and totally lacking in zen: duck egg blue on three walls and burgundy flock wallpaper on the fourth. On one wall was a floor to ceiling stencil of Rembrandt's cavalier. Couple that with the two tone burgundy-brown carpet and you have a right old mess. And all this for getting on for 400 euros per night. Also, the hose between the bath taps and shower fitting was missing, meaning a gush of water across the bathroom, and the pay per view in house movies kept stuttering and stalling. Nor did the promised free newspaper turn up on either day, and on the first night there was no turn down service. That said, the room was basically comfortable and quiet if a little chipped round the edges (bit of skirting board missing by the bed), and the bed very comfy indeed. Staff very nice. Breakfast expensive and nothing to shout about but you expect that in a so-called 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: clays4sue
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here. We realized it was a splurge, but it was worth it. Every aspect of our stay was wonderful. No one mentions the amazing exterior detailing of the hotel or the courtyard entry. Very charming. The Guest Services person, Zsa Zsa, went out of her way to greet us and treat us warmly. My only complaint is that is was several blocks from the nearest tram. The pool, although below ground level and small, is still lovely. I don't think it would be my choice with small children due to its sophistication.

Reviews.Title: “Top stay in Amsterdam - can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: boogiedown26
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is located right next to the RLD. Even in cold weather, it seemed to be a short walk from everything. We stayed in a suite that offered butler service. The service was outstanding. We have stayed at other top hotels/resorts (Four Seasons, Ritz) and this particular Sofitel location was up to snuff. Luis and Domingo went out of their way to help us out, as did the check-in staff. We also used the amenities (indoor pool) and my wife and her sister used the spa services. Great time! They also have working Macs with printers in the lobby area that came in really handy.

Reviews.Title: “AAAAAAAMAZING”
Reviews.Author: royroy65
Reviews.Content: My lovely Boyfriend took me the the Sofitel for a pre- Valantine weekend I have never ever stayed in such a grand hotel befor and felt like Julia Roberts from pritty women ( not that i,m a hooker nor am i a woman ok or pritty ) From the moment we steped out of the taxi we were treated like kings ( ok Queen then) i still look at my photos and dream of what a wonderful time we had ............................ i,m sure i will be back one day................. 11 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “A Grand time on the Canal...”
Reviews.Author: gigi35805
Reviews.Content: A truly beautiful and histoic building...a magnificent structure built in the 1500's but updated with the latest modern designs inside. A great mix. Very nice service from housekeeping and in the restaurant. The concierge staff was also top notch. We had a couple problems with front desk not understanding our needs due to language, but otherwise they tried very hard to assure top level service. The location was also wonderful since it allowed us to be a little off of the main streets but within a few short blocks of Dam Square and was able to walk to the Rijksmuseum (20 minutes tops) access to a number of the main attractions. Each morning we awoke to a view of the canal with a dozen or so swans swimming and the hooves of horses with carriages on the small road across the canal. We had a junior suite - it was spacious and had nice decor. Loved the bathrooms! And the turn down service with chololates on each of the nightstands. Only downside was they did not have the room down free (they understand the word feathers more than the word down) - so we had to order that again and wait, and the TV was not working and the phone had issues. The service people were all very nice though. Just a small pain to not be able to really relax till all the service folks came and went.

Reviews.Title: “fautless what an amazing hotel with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: gazza2303
Reviews.Content: the location the staff and the whole experince was simply amazing . every hotel in the world should base there customer experince on this one.are personel butler louis was a true gent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - wonderful Imperial Suite”
Reviews.Author: flo147
Reviews.Content: Hotel The Sofitel The Grand is a really amazing hotel. It is not an 'ordinary' Sofitel hotel, it is a so called Sofitel Legend hotel, which just a few Sofitel hotels get awarded with. The hotel was really nicely decorated over the X-mas session 2010. After a few discrepancies (expedia made an error concerning the room category), which were handled in a real professional way by the young receptionists, our butler Domingo showed us the way to our Imperial Suite. All in all, the check-in was fast, professional and moreover all A-Club Platinum benefits were given. They even went a step further than the published Platinum benefits (one room category upgrade) and did not walk us for the last days - many thanks to Mr. Hogetoorn for this pre-X-mas-present ;) Rating: 9.5/10 Location The location is exceptional - you are in the middle of Amsterdam when you step outside of the hotel. All main sightseeing attractions are close by. To compare it with their immediate competitor the IC Amstel, it is much more convenient and you really can feel the old charm of the city of Amsterdam when you stroll through the iconic canals just outside of the hotel. Rating: 9.5/10 Service The service is top-notch. First of all I really have to say a big thank you to Domingo. He was here for us whenever we needed something and w/o him we probably would have spent X-mas in Amsterdam due to the snow chaos. Compared to other properties, which offer butler service like the Burj al Arab, the Touessrok or the Townhouse Galleria, the butler service at the Sofitel The Grand was much more private and all in all much better than at the mentioned former properties. Also the guys at the reception greeted me every morning by name (but next time please not so formal :p) and also did a great job, as I already have mentioned. Service compared to the IC Amstel was also much better. Clear win for The Grand again. Rating: 10/10 Food Breakfast is compared to other hotels maybe a bit pricy but definitely worth it. You get champagne as well as nearly everything you could dream of. As far as I remember, I just missed a natural yoghurt there on one day. Room service is also efficient and tasty. We had dinner always outside at awesome restaurants due to the suggestions of Domingo. Rating: 8.5/10 Room I just say Imperial Suite. Well, the room was really cool. Big living room with working desk, 2 Nespresso machines, steam bath, awesome bed (I need such a bed at home too, so ship it over to me lol), 3 LCD TVs and so on and so on. The best thing is when you simply scroll through my pictures, then you will get the impression of this room ;) Compared to the IC Amstel, where we had an Executive Suite, the Imperial Suite was definitely bigger - around 110sqm - but still lacked a few things. I missed a bathroom scale and maybe some more amenities like a toothbrush. But I have to admit that you will get such things when you say it to your butler. Maybe a running map in pocket design could maybe also be provided in the room. But everything else, from the fine towels to the Hermes toiletries, was just outstanding. Rating: 9.5/10

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marckred Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel, good position, good elegance, good services, good rooms, a really pleasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: chhook
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sofitel "The Grand Amsterdam" hotel a number of times and found it to be outstanding. The city center location is excellent while also being quite and just a little bit removed from the hustle and bustle. I've found the staff to be initially reserved but warm up quickly if you actual converse with them. NOTE: My stays were a few years ago so the Feb 2010 date was the earliest date in the review menu,

Reviews.Title: “An average experience in a supposedly superior hotel”
Reviews.Author: katstrov
Reviews.Content: Although we had booked months previous to our arrival, we arrived to discover our children (13 & 15) had been put in a room on a completely different floor to us. The girl who assisted us at reception was very cold and almost rude. It was Christmas and although we could see that people were enjoying Christmas treats in the bar, we not asked to partake; nor were we given any introduction to the hotel facilities. This cold treatment continued for our entire stay (5 nights). The concierge made us feel that any question or required assistance was an imposition - it was really unbelievable. Probably felt even more as we had just previously been in a hotel in Prague (The Augustine) which was not only superior in every way, but where the staff were so warm and friendly we felt sad to leave!! Anyway - our rooms, although attractive, were tiny with far too much furniture/lamps etc which we were forever bumping into! The bathrooms were tiny, so we continually tripped over each other. The beds were too too soft, even by European standards. The breakfasts (not included) were exorbitant - infact the only saving grace was that the rooms contained an espresso machine, so we could have our morning coffee then eat elsewhere!! We have previously stayed at the Pulitzer, which is old but charming - I would definitely not stay at The Grand Amsterdam again, I could have forgiven all of the room faults if the services at the front desk had been friendlier..... but there is no excuse for cold staff

Reviews.Title: “quite expensive but extremely good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Quite expensive hotel but extremely good location and quality of service. I highly recommend if money is not o problem :)

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny rooms and no internet service!”
Reviews.Author: poogleypie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really a disappointment. It is supposed to be one of the nicer hotels in Amsterdam. The location is good, and everything seemed fresh and new inside. However, the whole experience was one disappointment after another. When I checked in, they could not find my reservation, even though I had the paperwork to go with it (reserved through American Express travel). Finally they said they found it and gave me a reservation printout with someone else's name and address - I pointed out that it wasn't mine, and they insisted it was and crossed that person's name off and wrote mine in. I hope that person didn't have a problem getting their room. My room wasn't ready (not surprising since it was actually someone else's room) so they agreed to store my luggage. Beware that their luggage storage appears to be just leaving all of the luggage in the main reception. I sat in the reception for about an hour before leaving for a meeting, and my suitcase remained with the piles of others out in the open the whole time. The room was absolutely tiny. I was traveling on business and supposedly had a superior room. There was just enough space on either side of the bed for a useless bedside table (not actually large enough for placing anything there), and that was it. The bed was a double size bed, not a queen or king. In other words, the bed is only a bit bigger than a single size bed and certainly far too small for two people. There was barely enough room between the end of the bed and the desk to squeeze through. The bathroom was a good size, with a nice walk in shower, but no bath tub. There was no wireless internet service. Instead you had to buy (at a hefty charge) a little scratch off card from the front desk for a local wireless service, but after many attempts I still could not get this to work because the wireless signal did not reach the room. They sent someone to the room but he could not get it to work either. It is absolutely unacceptable for a hotel that pretends to be 5 star not to have internet access. Actually, hotels of any star should offer internet access and most do. I don't really understand what is going on at the Sofitel but I don't intend to return to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience, best hotel in Amsterdam so far!”
Reviews.Author: snagg__v
Reviews.Content: We are still at the hotel, we will be leaving tomorrow. The stay here so far has been amazing. As soon as we arrived we were warmly welcomed and informed that we were the "guest of the day" as such we were entitled to a room upgrade (we got a junior suite), private concierge and late check-out to suit our flight schedule. The location of the hotel is very central, close to pretty much every attraction of the city. The concierge was really helpful when we were looking for a sushi restaurant. Rooms are definitely nice and well furnished; in the suites have a complimentary coffee machine is included which is a nice touch for us avid coffee drinkers. Everyday they offered us a different present with a hand signed letter from the hotel manager and the guest relationship manager; it was a totally unexpected and very welcomed surprise. The hotel has also a SPA and a swimming pool but we didn't have a chance to use either of them. So far the best hotel we've stayed at here in AMS, looking forward to coming back here in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: phastidious
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful common parts and comfortable bedrooms, complete with nespresso machines. Centrally situated with apparently attentive staff it is fine until you want something, like breakfast, or dinner, or lunch, or a coffee, or a taxi, or indeed anything at all. They screwed up every single time. It just all goes to pieces. The hotel was fully booked. That means 250 people. The restaurant only sits 80. Everyone comes for breakfast at once. There are no tables, not enough food, not enough staff. This would be ok if they didn't expect it. However they knew. They just didn't care. And by the way, breakfast is not included in their fancy room price (and neither is wifi!). Dinner - with three young children we waited nearly 90 minutes for the starters! The main courses were wrong. Side orders were missing. The drinks were good though. Hardly made up for it because, of course, the kids were going up the wall as a consequence of the useless service. The concierge, whether ordering a cab, renting bikes, indeed anything, got it all wrong. They didn't bother to order a cab until the last minute - even though we had to be punctual and had ordered the cabs with them at least a day in advance. They got the bike renting so wrong that it was just pathetic and ruined our last morning there. And just in case you think this was perhaps a "one-off", we ordered coffee in the lounge. They forgot to bring it. When they did bring it, it was wrong. And they forgot the cake to go with it. Frankly, and as I explained to them at the time, their hotel is let down by the management staff at every level. Interestingly, they agreed with me! One delightful and apologetic waiter in the restaurant cannot make up for this utterly appalling state of affairs. But, their complete and utter ineptitude continued even after my complaints to them. My advice, choose another hotel. A lovely room (even with television in the bath) is not enough and the whole thing really did ruin this family break.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with very nice staff. Room didnt have a bath though!”
Reviews.Author: BigFozMorecambe_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel with loads of staff fussing over your every move. On arrival I was a little dissapointed that our superior room only had a shower, not a bath but other than that it was a nice room and very well appointed. Also it doesnt have free wifi and at this price it should have! The hotel has been recently been refitted and it shows. Everything is magnificent and clean and everyone of the staff is really smart and pleasant. On Sundays you gett o breakfast in the old council chambers which is an amazing room. The hotel is situated right in the middle of the action being right next to the main city and the red light district. It couldnt be nearer to see the sights but yet is totally quiet and calm inside. We will definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AshleyDCandBrussels
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fantastic staff, great location. Total luxury and very service oriented. The building itself has a wonderful history. Parking is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Never a 5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hargar
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam with Partner who was at hotel for a conference. Hotel facade was covered in scaffolding. The hotel accepted a reservation for a Premium Suite with Canal View. Canal view completely obscured by scaffolding, except for one window in bedroom. Other bedroom window looks straight into somebody's apartment!! Probably a good room if you are a voyeur. To say this was a Premier Suite is a joke. It looks to be furnished by Ikea, although at least with Ikea furniture you dont usually have electical wires and extension cables running along the floor in full view. The dark brown and crimson carpet does not help the ambiance either. Bed is extremely comfortable but with only 12" of space either side of the bed it is a tight fit. Luckily their was no cat to swing!! Workmen started work directly outside the room at 7.45am making further sleep impossible, despite being told by reception staff that we should not be bothered by noise!! Buffet Breakfast at 34Euros is a joke. Staff are friendly but basically clueless. It took 3 goes at getting someone to bring a pepper pot to the table!! And had somebody else's breakfast delivered to the table twice by mistake by two different people! I suppose this maybe considered a 5* hotel if you think travelling by Easyjet or Ryanair is luxurious. It is just a rather clumsy attempt by a rather mediocre chain, Sofitel, of trying to move into the luxury travel section, when they should stay doing what they do well, 3* - 4* hotels. Last month I stayed at true 5* hotels from the Aman & Shangri-la Chains, Sofitel comes nowhere near their level. I am not the only person to be upset with the hotel, 4 other delegates from the hotel are very disappointed here and some even changed rooms. I

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable staff”
Reviews.Author: sabisf
Reviews.Content: Great location. Loved the privacy of the courtyard. Most of the hotels had the entrance right off the street, but the grand has a nice couryard so it doesn't feel like your falling into the street. The decor was very trendy and comfortable. The staff was wonderful! The concierge was very helpful and everyone was super friendly. The breakfast buffet was very good. The room was nice but small. The bathroom expecially was very uncomfortable. It was long and narrow and the toilet did not have much privacy from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lush Lush Lush”
Reviews.Author: SPBLondon
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel - the room was total wow factor, walk in to a large bathroom on the left, storage to the right and then down 5 steps to the bedroom area - a brilliant use of space. So modern but not tacky, very stylish, amazing double height windows. After a morning of sightseeing we spent every afternoon lazing around on that huge sofitel bed, and have now invested in our own goose down mattress topper to keep the luxury going. Skip the breakfast if you can, the restaurant was nothing special and better value elsewhere. Definitely visit the cigar shop a few blocks away (a worthy tourist trip in its own right) and enjoy in the hotel courtyard with a wine or two.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Luxury and Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover23456
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, the Sofitel Amsterdam The Grand offered us a free upgrade from the "Prestige Suite" we reserved, to their "Imperial Suite." Not knowing the difference, I accepted the offer, only to find that the difference was indeed substantial. The Imperial Suite was enormous and extraordinarily luxurious -- one of the largest hotel rooms in which I've ever stayed, and the suite was replete with fresh flowers everywhere, free gifts of wine, fresh fruit and bottled water, 1.5 baths, monstrous living quarters, a glorious master bathroom, a changing room, a steam shower, butler service, modern electronics everywhere, and THE most comfortable bed and pillows I think I've ever experienced. All the furnishings in the suite were modern and very new ... so much so that we actually considered whether we were the very first people to stay in that particular suite since it was refurbished. The hotel is very nice generally, but this upgraded room (which retails for about 3 to 4 times what we paid for our "Prestige Suite") helped make our stay in Amsterdam unforgettable. If you can justify the splurge on the Imperial Suite, book it for a memorable experience. (In case there's more than one Imperial Suite, ask for the William the 5th Suite.) Aside from the remarkable room, the hotel extrance is an old-style very "grand" courtyard, which leads into a modernly furnished and attractive lobby. The staff was outstanding throughout the entire stay. Areas of the newly refurbished Spa were still under construction at the time we were there, but The Grand offers a good-sized indoor pool -- quite unusual in Europe -- which was open and wonderful. The only potentially negative we experienced was the corridors. While they look very clean, they are definitely old-style and had a slightly musty smell. This wasn't a problem for us because those same hallways led to our extremely clean and glorious suite. But the hallways did create a rather unusual dichotomy: Old-style architecture and entrance courtyard, very modern lobby, old-style corridors, very modern suite. Not a problem, just unusual. Overall, we had a truly wonderful hotel experience and one we'll surely always remember among our all-time best. The Grand gets my strongest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Calm amongst chaos”
Reviews.Author: sunshinenow66
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with friendly staff. You sometimes get forgotten when asking for drinks, but everyone has a smile for you. Rooms are small but well furnished, and want for nothing. You are in the middle of town and next to red light district, but inside the hotel it is calm and wonderful. Some of the drinks are expensive, but overall there are few negatives for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: We often travel to Amsterdam and most hotels in the city are small, old, worn, as well as being expensive. We stayed at the Radisson Blu last year and although the rooms were big, it was rather dark in the room and felt more like a business hotel. This year we stayed at the Sofitel and we were very impressed by the renovations they've done. Just walking into the large front courtyard gives you a relaxed feeling right away making you feel at home. The hotel is conveniently located in the city centre of Amsterdam. We stayed for 2 nights in interconecting Superior rooms. The bathrooms were brand new and large (no bath, just shower) but the rooms were compact. We have no complaints about the service, it was sometimes a bit quirky but we wouldn't say it was bad service. Staff were all very nice. There are 2 iMacs in the cozy lounge by the lobby with free access to the internet. Otherwise in the room it's 17 Euros a day. We had the buffet breakfasts on both mornings which had a great selection but at 32 Euros per person you'd hope so. We had dinner in Bridges one night and although the raw seafood platter was extremely good, the main course was average. We'd definitely come back to this hotel again. It's very comfortable and a great place to stay in Amsterdam. The hotel has a similar feel to the Sofitel St James in London.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it better before the remodel”
Reviews.Author: richardsonsnm1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand a dozen times, but i had not been back since it was remodeled. Now I do agree that the bathrooms needed work, the showers were a joke, water all over the floor every time you used them. They have been improved greatly. My problem is with the rest of the room, very poorly designed. Try to get to the closet or the in room safe, almost impossible. The lighting is just TERRIBLE. The color schemes do not help being very dark. It is just not possible to sit in the living room of the suite and do anything but maybe watch TV. The spa was under construction but i did get a peak inside, nice addition. The Library internet area is probably the nicest addition but with just two computers it was constantly in use. The new restaurant, Bridges is touted as one of Amsterdam's finest, I thought that the breakfast buffet was nowhere near as nice as the former Roux offerings so we did not bother. We did enjoy the bar staff and the oysters, the staff could not have been better and more helpful. I think that maybe they should have fixed the bathrooms and changed the furniture and TV's but left the hotels charm alone. We used to enjoy hanging out in our Suite and having drinks and room service, but the ambiance has been ruined. I have stayed in many of the Suites and Jr. Suites but i have mixed feelings about returning, I have no idea what room I would request. I found the front office staff excellent as was the concierge. Anyone that goes to Amsterdam and does not buy their tickets to the Van Gogh from a concierge is making a very BIG mistake, you simply bypass the huge line and go to the fast track line, no waiting. My first hotel that I stayed at was the Hotel De L'Europe, which is also into a very large remodel, and i am afraid they are making some of the same mistakes that the Grand has made and have gone too modern.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise186394
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beginning of June and it was a fantastic hotel, the staff could not have been more attentive. Only minor downside - my room faced one of the canals and was slightly noisy now and again, would suggest If you want a quiet room ask for a room overlooking the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but staff not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: Pauline010
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel and met friends there. On their arrival (after a transatlantic flight) their room was not ready and after waiting for over an hour, were upgraded and taken to their room, which was beautiful. We arrived the following day at 3pm. Our room was not ready either, but we sat in the fantastic courtyard and had some drinks with our friends. We went back to the reception a couple of times to check on our room, which was still not ready. At 6pm, my patience run out and receptionist agreed to upgrade our room, to one immediately available. The reason given for the room not being available was due to other guests having late check-outs but surely this can only be granted by the hotel when nobody is due into the room later the same day. The hotel decor is fantastic, both in the public areas and rooms. Toiletries are nice and plentiful and bed is very comfortable. The location is great and everything is within walking distance. You would not be aware that the red light district is nearby as you access the hotel from the other side. We had ordered a picnic for midday on one of the days. Even though I checked three times with the receptionist that it would be ready, it was not and we had to wait for 30 minutes. We have stayed in other Sofitel hotels around the world and have no complaints. The staff at this hotel, although pleasant, really let down the hotel reputation. I have to agree with previous comments that they have no interest in serving customers, but, newsflash, that is their job! We never ate in the hotel so cannot make any comment. We had breakfast in the cafe over the canal (Bredero's). It looks a bit 'greasy spoon' but is not and serves the best omelettes and pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: DoubleScorpio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights in August and our overall impressions of the hotel were extremely favourable from the excellent location and impressive decor to the cleanliness of the room. Our only gripe was with the service, both in the bar and the restaurant when we had breakfast. It was painfully slow, and the waiting staff suffered from tunnel vision, ignoring our attempts to catch their attention. Someone needs to do a time and motion exercise to improve things - why have waitresses standing around doing nothing because (presumably) it is not in their remit to, for example, take your order but instead just to clear tables? That irritation aside, tho, I would not hesitate to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LosRobertsons
Reviews.Content: So beautiful and modern and perfectly clean. Great place for travelers who like nothing but the best. The location was excellent, so close to everything, but beware, it is also very close to the red light district, so, if you may be offended by it, don't stay there or don't take a right once you leave the hotel. It didn't bother us at all so I didn't see it as a problem. The room we stayed was pretty small, but the bed was the most comfortable ever! the curtains were heavy and dark so you could relax and nap at any time of the day. The bathroom was large and very modern and the toiletries excellent. I may be going to other Sofitels around the world!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, great service. One of the best in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nymark2
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just great. It is right in the center of the city. You can walk just about anywhere from the hotel. And the walk from the Central train station is only about 10 minutes. Front reception was very friendly. A man showed us to our room which was on the fourth floor in the corner. They called it a junior suite with two twin beds. Windows looked out onto the front of the hotel over the canal. Very nice views. Bathroom was fantastic. Big tub and separate shower with a window. There was a TV in the bathroom and stereo speakers. The only thing I didn't care for was the glass swing open bathroom doors which did not give enough privacy. Room was very clean. Beds were very comfortable. Some of the best I have experienced. Plenty of room to walk around and separate closets to put clothes. I did not try the restaurant. It was expensive, but looked very nice. The courtyard in the center of the hotel is very nice for drinks. A little expensive, the the atmosphere is worth it. There is a coffee shop right outside the hotel. Every morning and afternoon we would walk by and smell the pot that they were smoking there. Didn't bother me (it's Amsterdam after all), but I wasn't expecting something like that so close to the hotel. Staff at checkout was very friendly. Overall, my stay here was excellent and I would definitely return. The sofitel beds and pillows are so comfortable. This sofitel ranks in the top 3 that I have stayed at. Get a good deal by booking a promotion through their website and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, though it is expensive, let down by service which was not great”
Reviews.Author: KeninWLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days in August. Delighted to get an upgrade to a junior suite and very impressed to be taken their by our "personal butler". The hotel location is fantastic - right next to but not in, the busiest part of town. The room was huge, a wonderful canal view, with every amenity possible .......at first sight. There was a Nespresso machine which we used, the capsules were never replaced so after 6 cups between two of us we had to ask for more. There was some fruit in the room - we ate it and it was not replaced. It was a lottery as to what combination of bath towels, small towels and face cloths would appear. We asked the butler to arrange afternoon tea in the library for us and 3 friends - nothing special, it was an advertised service. 5 minutes later he was up in the room with menus asking us to choose - but the friends were not due until the afternoon so we said we would decide specifics then. (The specifics were which tea, and did we want champagne). Friends arrived, no sign of tea in the library and no one knew of then request. Butler was summoned and appeared to sort it out - 4 teas arrived for 5 people. The hotel was very expensive - even for a junior suite - you are paying for location and room. Service was pretty second rate. One final thing - we had the room buy the lift and every time it moved we could hear it winding up and down. Did not stop us sleeping but it did disturb our sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...and so close to being perfect”
Reviews.Author: LadyF1
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a grand, luxurious hotel. The location was pretty central and you can walk to any tourist areas. There were building works going on outside the building but this did not detract from the hotel and there were not any disturbances. Having said that, the coffee maker in the room was extremely dusty and in need of a good clean. Also when i tried to use it, i found that the inside was dirty too. Not really acceptable for a Â£300 a night hotel. This was the only downside. Other than that, great hotel, great location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven close to the red light district”
Reviews.Author: swiss_nomad
Reviews.Content: Only a few steps away from the hustle and bustle around the Old Church and yet as quiet as a mansion in the countryside: That's the Amsterdam Grand Sofitel for you. It's so centrally located that you can actually walk from Amsterdam Centraal train station. Also some of the best restaurants are in close proximity. The hotel used to be a convent and later Amsterdam city hall. Don't miss the council hall, the mayor's office and the marriage chamber â€“ they are all open to the public.

Reviews.Title: “A real "Grand" hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeV_Wolverine
Reviews.Content: A real AAA hotel perfectly located in the heart of Amsterdam with efficient service and smiling personnel. Would definitely go back whether on business or for a leisure staying.

Reviews.Title: “our new favourite Ansterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: labarkley
Reviews.Content: After a glorious refurb. this hotel is looking stunning. The staff seem really to enjoy their work, they are very smart too. Service is superb, friendly, yet very professional. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a junior suite for 60 euros a night, we did and were not disappointed. The decor is plush, the bathroom in black slate, a huge bath -freestanding and glorious toiletries. We had views from our 5th floor across the Amsterdam rooftops and canals. The hotel could not be in a better position, close to bars, restaurants, sleaze - if you want it and shops. The prices were what you would expect in a 5* hotel, the bar prices were actually reasonable. There is building work in the spa area, we didn't notice so much as a workman, this will be finished in August. We had room service, the food was decent quality, but the menu is limited, great croque monsieur though. There is a simply stunning courtyard bar and restaurant area, which was always lively, being a courtyard it was also an oasis from the hedonistic delights outside. The room was quiet, with excellent air conditioning, TV had BBC1 and2 and a few other English Channels. Parking was 50 Euros a night, but that was to be expected here. Also bottled water seemed very expensive compared to other drinks. The nicest touch was when they brought the car when we left and there was a gift for the journey home; two bottles of water, two muesli bars and two wipe up towelettes, how sweet is that?

Reviews.Title: “Very swish but needs to grow into into its personality and up service”
Reviews.Author: Gemstone4ever
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with gorgeous courtyard and very well appointed, modern rooms. super high spec bathrooms with proper hairdryer and nice toilettries. Nespresso machine fab touch. Wonderful bed and linen. Nice 5" welcome home when returned from work. BEST club sandwich ever. My criticism lies with the service. On a sunny day, they were understaffed in the courtyard and I waited half an hour for a glass of wine after first order was forgotten. The bar is stylish but feels awkward. I hope these are growing pains re refurb and new restaurant. Will be back to see.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Grand in Amsterdam was absolutely lovely, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: JanisNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for overnight accommodation. The decor and customer service was fabulous. However the price of the food was ridiculous and there are lots of places to eat out at less than half the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “An Expensive Gem”
Reviews.Author: mntraveler46
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for lots of money. The room we reserved was much smaller in person than on the website. On inspection we wanted to upgrade and pay. Reception gave us a suite at a reduced price which was very fair. The only odditiy: the hallway to the bathroom went up a half-step, then down then up again. A bit trying in the middle of the night. Also, breakfast was hugely expensive--$90/2 but extraordinary. Champagne and everything one could want. No chance for an egg and some toast--all $45.Otherwise, the location, staff, room and food were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel with smart new renovation”
Reviews.Author: burgsSydney
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the entrance and the courtyard have been renovated beautifully. The decoration is trendy, cozy, romantic and elegant. The rooms are a nice size, the bathrooms renovated and are smart with nice amenities. Our room had its own Nespresso machine. The hotel is conveniently located and in walking distance to movies, galleries(- the Van Gogh is a must see! ) The staff is incredibly helpful and efficient! We would recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel--great staff”
Reviews.Author: lhs76
Reviews.Content: We wanted a canal view and were given one, in the section of the hotel facing the back. At around 6:00 the next morning, we were awakened by the garbage collection crew below our window. The next morning, customer relations staffer Zsa Zsa(pronounced T-sa T-sa) asked how our room was, and I asked how often the garbage was collected. "Daily," she said with a frown. "Was that a problem?" Told that it was, Zsa Zsa said she would look into it. About an hour later, she had us upgraded to another room at no additional cost, and she sent us a complimentary bottle of wine for our trouble. We were there during the Iceland volcano eruption and were able to keep our room beyond our check out date. The entire concierge staff was excellent, both in recommending restaurants and in trying to rebook our return flight, which was a challenging task at that time. We would take a stroll to our pet breakfast spot, on the Rokin across from one of the places where you take a canal cruise, called Meuwese. Nothing special, but friendly, prompt, and a good bit less expensive than the hotel breakfast. When we were there, the fitness center consisted of an elliptical and a treadmill. However, we were told a full-fledged spa was scheduled to open soon. The hotel restaurant "Bridges" was quite good, but a bit fancier than what we would normally choose. Nevertheless an excellent rainy day choice.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely stay at Hotel The Grand”
Reviews.Author: happyhallow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night in the Easter weekend with three children. The service was excellent. Staff really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The rooms were lovely decorated. The children were thrilled to find huge chocolate bunnies in their rooms. The restaurant was excellent. You need to book way ahead of time because it is often full. Breakfast was a bit chaotic not enough staff to keep up with everybody. We organized a small boat with captain from the hotel. A bit expensive but really worth seeing Amsterdam from a boat through the canals. It is a lovely hotel. Nicely decorated and quiet location. Unfortunately they were renovating the spa area so we could not try out the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price, 5 stars all around”
Reviews.Author: NancyMM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fabulous, courteous helpful staff and Guido the concierge among the best ever! Convenient central location, excellent restaurants. Beautiful building and rooms, immaculate, comfortable - Wow!! Only negative was that like most nicer European hotels, they expect you to eat a large and very expensive breakfast buffet. A la carte only available via room service. Great guest lounge on main floor with 2 complimentary computers (and free internet) for guest use was a nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: tulsanative
Reviews.Content: The beds at The Grand are actually like sleeping on cloud. As a couple who sleep on a Tempurpedic in the US, this bed is ten times more comfortable. Incredible sleeping on this lovely feather bed with a feather duvet. The service is impeccable and I'm sure they would cheerfully scrape gum off the sole of my shoe had I asked. Every detail was attended to and the turn-down service included the most incredible chocolate truffles I've ever had! it's right on the canal and just a block from the boat tours, and the neighborhood where you can walk all day to see the lovely touristy shops or the high end shopping district. The Grand keeps taxis on hand for a ride at a moments notice. This place has a historic history and the breakfast buffet was delicious. We're American so they made lovely scrambled eggs from scratch and there were plenty of meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, and breads including those heavenly croissants. In case you can't tell this place ROCKS! It's well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Total Luxury and a real hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: throppy
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best hotel I've stayed in in Amsterdam. We actually drove there from the UK, and the valet met us, and deposited our car in the garage - the parking was included in the price, so that was nice. The hotel was realyl plush, and you enter via a courtyard, so even if you walk past the hotel, you have no idea what it's like inside unless you go in. Lovely room, with opulent decor, overlooking a lovely courtyard at the rear of the hotel. Filled with lovely vegetation, it was nice to not be looking over the street, and gave a real feel of privacy. Great location, just moments from Dam Square, and the Red Light District. Not cheap, but so much nicer than staying anywhere else in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Good bits and Bad bits, Bad bits outweigh the good bits...”
Reviews.Author: daami1988
Reviews.Content: Not the worst of hotels, but several issues made it less than enjoyable. We had arranged for a limosine pick up from Schiphol, but our flight got cancelled. We informed the hotel we would be getting there later therefore please arrange the limo later - but they didn't and then had the gall to blame me for their incompentency! They said I would be forced to pay the full charge, something which I kicked up a great deal of fuss about, and they eventually agreed to reduce it by 50%. As a matter of principle I should not have had to pay anything. But with it being a holiday I didn't want to have long arguments with the manager so I agreed so as to get him off my back. Something which irritated me, but nonetheless was one headache taken care of. Next. The window in the hotel was smashed, reported to concierge, they didn't do anything so we had cold drafts coming in at night. When I booked I was told the spa would be in full operation. When I rang to confirm the booking they said it was under renovation - another empty promise there. Instead they sent me to a hotel round the corner which I could use instead - only thing is it was open for only 6 hours a day at really awkward times and was the size of a shoebox! The night staff were brilliant, I have nothing bad to say about them - they were extremely helpful, especially the bald chap (there's only one!) and made sure our every need was taken care of. Unfortunately with the price that I paid for the half assed service I got, I will not be returning here - Marriot seems to be a much better deal with the same facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience..”
Reviews.Author: Billt_Ath
Reviews.Content: The Grand is suitably located at the heart of the medieval city and the atmosphere has a touch of real "grandieuse". However, the staff totally ruined it for us: We booked through hotel's own website and opted for the "stay 4 -pay 3 nights" package. It was clear that breakfast was not inclusive and as we always enjoy our breakfast during vacation, we clicked the extra "breakfast" option as well. We received shortly a confirmatory email, with a total reservation price which included breakfast as requested. However, after checking-in and during breakfast, staff seemed unaware that we decided to include the breakfast option during our reservation and insisted that breakfast was not included in the price. Staff also seemed unwilling (or uncapable) to check the details of our reservation with their own reservation confirmatory email. Thankfully we brought a printout with us, and brought it to the reception desk. The scene with the Reservation Manager taking curious looks and questioning their own email was less than pleasant and unheard of from a 5 star establishment. We received no apologies for this annoyance during our stay. For the history, the balance (for the stay 4-pay 3 package incl. breakfast) was 4 euros less than our initial total reservation price!!! Sofitel The Grand management really needs to set things straight with regards to their reservation, billing and attitude towards guests policies.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Amersterdam”
Reviews.Author: boomergal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the middle of a renovation, so sometimes the elevator didn't work. But the staff was very friendly and always took us up in the 'construction' elevator. The breakfast there was wonderful. We did not eat dinner there, however, as it was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel room I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Scottoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September with three friends. I travel frequently and have stayed in a lot of hotels worldwide. This hotel had one of the best standard of bedrooms I have seen. The beds are amazingly comfortable. The bathrooms are incredibly modern with fantastic rain showers. It is close to the red light district but if you turned left out of the hotel then you may not have noticed. Staff were wonderful and attentive. The restaurant was a little short staffed during the breakfast which led to delays but there are few who would possibly want to pay for it. Although good, very expensive - even by hotel standards. Wonderful architecture and history to the building which I prefer to modern hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not a true 5-star”
Reviews.Author: doucemelody
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i have just spent 2 nights at the Sofitel Amsterdam The Grand. The location was great, the decoration of great taste but the service was not worthy of a 5-star. If you intend to use the spa facilities, please be aware that it is currently being renovated, so no access there. We booked the cheapest room which featured : - No bathtub (never seen that in any hotel at all, let alone a "5-star" ! - Broken glass on the floor ! (they apologized and offered us a complementary bottle of wine, which was nice). - No TV remote control (i had to go down to reception to ask for one..). - No direct access by phone to the reception. - Dusty shelves in the bathroom. - Scratches on the furniture. - The complementary bottle of water was not replaced overnight. Except for the glass, you might think that these are small details of no importance, but when you add them all together it does somehow lessen the appeal of this great hotel and diminishes the rating too. Still a very good place to stay. The staff are kind and well intentioned, but it shouldn't be hard work for the customer as it was for me. We did not have lunch nor breakfast in the hotel, so i cannot comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Artiha
Reviews.Content: I have been in many luxurious hotels all over the world and I can affirm that this hotel is one of the best, without any doubt. The location of the hotel is excellent, the room (suite) is fantastically furnished and the staff is incredibly polite.

Reviews.Title: “In so many ways exceptional but slightly disappointing this time”
Reviews.Author: arthurh
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at this hotel as a treat for a few days away for total relaxation. Arrived by car and from the moment we went into the courtyard service could not be bettered anywhere. However I chose this hotel for two real reasons, firstly the Spa and secondly the central location. The spa was closed for refurbishment ! I didnt realise the hotel was literally on the edge of the red light district, for many people that wouldnt be a problem but at a weekend especially the whole area is crawling with drunken stag party revellers, unfortunately many are British using foul language and flouting any drinking in the street laws etc etc. Not what I wanted from a romantic weekend away, I am sure that during the week this wouldnt be too much of an issue and anyway instead of turning right from the hotel just turn left, it is different again and you see the real Amsterdam. The spa being closed was a real issue as we just wanted to relax, the hotel offered us the opportunity to be bussed to another hotel they use the facilities of, but I declined as its not the same as being able to walk downstairs in the fluffy robe just when you feel like it. So we cancelled our third night and moved on to Bruges. Would I stay there again, yes almost certainly, the spa being closed wasnt their fault although I wish I had been told on booking and the location, whilst being a little intimidating, is so central and exceptional by just walking the other way. The concierge was really very good, booking us at the very last minute an exceptionally good restaurant, the five flies, and on leaving there was mad panic when we decided to leave a day early as apparently the concierge hadnt got my "parcel" ready for the car. The car was brought to the door, he hurried off and came back with "the parcel". This consisted of sustenance for the journey, a couple of apples, breakfast bars and 2 bottles of water, a very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand is a 10”
Reviews.Author: MikaStanford
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this wonderful hotel for five days and loved it. Great atmosphere, beautiful architecture and even better service. This hotel can be recommended to everyone who is visiting Amsterdam. It is near al the big tourist attractions and the Central Station. The rooms are very comfortable and the interior is outstanding. This hotel has my vote for best hotel in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: TitaCatita
Reviews.Content: My husband and me booked an escapade, at promotional rates, got upgraded to an apartment suite! Although we didn't use the first floor, it was a nice touch! The location is great; although close to everything, walking distance from the train station, the Dam, the main places, it is an oasis of quiet, a chic ambiance. The hotel itself is worth seeing, with its colored glasses and reminiscences of distinguished guests from bygone times. We didn't try the facilities though, but what we saw was good enough. The service is excellent, (very untypical of the locals, unfortunately), from the reception staff, to Udo, the concierge who makes miracles, or Peter, the bell boy. Would go back, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: KWH1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice for a weekend city break in Amsterdam. I stayed 2 nights with friends and the hotel made it such an enjoyable experience! The rooms are luxurious and a good size with fantastic beds making it very hard to get up in the morning! We had a great view over the canal and were not disturbed by any noise. Rooms contained all the amenities needed and staff were extremely helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: herbie1709
Reviews.Content: just returned from the sofitel booked a surprise 50th birthday for my husband. hotel ,rooms, staff, and location were fantastic. the hotel staff were wonderful and made every effort to make our stay special. they presented my husband with a cake and domingo the waiter in the resturant was very hospitable and really nice guy, providing us with information of the city . thanks again to the sofitel we will be back. lorraine, mick robinson and john and lynne hewitt. ps domingo enjoy your friends wedding dont get to drunk you have to work the next day x

Reviews.Title: “historic hotel at top location”
Reviews.Author: panda58
Reviews.Content: location in amsterdam is unbeatable;close to the very centre,next to red light district and still quiet.rooms very nice and faultless.atmosphere is great and cozy.business rooms are splendid.one of the best locations for visiting amsterdam. not very easy to reach when traffic is busy.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Evelgirl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel that was once a Convent. Stayed 2 nights in July. Room was spacious and contemporary with flatscreen TV and great channels. Nice coffee machine. Big bathroom, yes, the shower did leak but have had that happen in other hotels. Had a view of the courtyard, unfortunately they were working on it while we were there and we did hear some noise. Breakfast in the restaurant was overpriced. Great location! 5 minutes from Dam Square(and the Tram), 2 minutes to the Red Light District, 15 minute walk to Central Station. Tons of shopping, restaurants and coffeeshops around but the hotel is set back enough away from the hustle and bustle. Staff was pleasant and helpful. I will definately stay here the next time I go to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirladelaide
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, 10 minutes walk to the Central Station. But some locals got it mixed up with other Sofitel and it took us a while to find it. Although it is right next to the red light district, it is tucked away and is quiet and safe. It is close to most sight seeing places. The room is spacious, tastefully refurnished and well designed. The bathroom is simple, clean and contemporary. I am very fussy about bathroom and I was happy with this. But water leaked from the glass partition of the shower. The hotel is still undergoing some major renovation but it did not create any noise. They provided free internet at the business centre. The restaurant was a pleasant surprise. The food was nice and not too over priced. It is trully a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice - great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: mhl01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel more then once. Great place. Check out the cafe's around the corner, like Cafe de Pool in de Oude Hoogstraat 8, one bridge away. This is my favorite. They have a great art collection of 40 works on the wall by contemporary Dutch artists. This 85 year old artist-cafe is different from the rest in the neighborhood, and a great place for coffee, sandwich or a beer ;-)

Reviews.Title: “faultless overnight stay; can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: philipellis
Reviews.Content: we (2 couples) stayed at this hotel for one night in mid march - a brief weekend stay in Amsterdam to celebrate my wife's recovery from illness. we checked in at 11 a.m; it was somewhat disappointing to be told that neither of our rooms were ready despite asking in advance for at least one room to be prepared for an early check in, but it didn't really matter and our bags were put aside whilst we went out for lunch. as we checked in, we asked if our rooms were nice, and one of our party requested the availability of refurbished rooms; we each secured these for a â‚¬40 premium, and went out for lunch. when we returned at about 3.30 pm, our rooms were ready, and they were spectacular. beautifully decorated, immaculately clean and a fantastic bathroom, with a good sized walk in shower; really top notch. at the same time, my wife and I each booked a treatment in the spa; she opted for a reflexology session, and I chose a deep tissue massage. we then wandered over to dam sq (300m away) for a bit of people watching in the cafe there. we also asked the concierge for a good steak restaurant; he recommended the informal torro de rado where we enjoyed the best steaks we have ever had in our lives and the most tender ribs. it was however well more than a 10 minute walk from the hotel as the concierge thought; it was especially difficult for our ladies in high heels; next time we'd get a taxi. incidentally, the next day the same concierge suggested we went to the bakerswinkel for breakfast. it too was spot on, just across dam sq from the hotel. we returned to the hotel in time for our treatments. my wife emerged from her reflexology session with Dan looking 10 years younger and glowing; my hour long massage with Sarah shot by in what felt like 20 mins and I felt fab. If both ladies read this review, many thanks. we have both had treatments in many other places, but both agreed that these 2 were the tops I also went for a swim before my massage; nice pool, nice changing rooms; adequate to stretch off any jet lag. There is also a small reasonably equipped gym, and a couple of sauna cabins. the hotel is located just on the edge of the red light area, and you have to go through this area to get to Dam Sq, but its not threatening as it once was several years ago, and there were plenty of police in evidence. prostitution is clearly legal in Holland, and the site of scantily dressed women touting for business in the infamous Amsterdam glass doorways is not for the faint hearted. When we returned to the hotel at about 12.30 a.m, we asked if there was a bar open. We were directed upstairs to a comfortable lounge (the bar is apparently being refurbished) and we were well looked after by the pleasant barman 'til about 1.30, tho we were the only ones in the lounge. At the heart of any of our stays is the question of cleanliness; we will not be happy with anywhere which is dirty or grubby. This hotel was immaculate, with crisp bed linen and towels, and clean bedrooms, bathrooms and common areas. Coupled with a wonderful location, brilliant concierge and well organised (our masseuses came into the hotel to meet our bookings; they seem to be 'sub contracted' by the hotel) and of the highest standards massage treatments, we would immediately and happily stay here again. this hotel wasn't cheap, but for 1 night the price wasn't the be all and end all of our stay. it was beautiful and we have no criticisms to make; we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Losing a Couple of Steps”
Reviews.Author: telco
Reviews.Content: The Grand is possibly my favorite hotel in the world, having worked in 25 countries. But, nevertheless: I confess to being somewhat... disappointed with my stay November 12 - 15, 2008. I have repeatedly recommended the hotel in the past to my firm's clients over the past decade. Now... I am not so sure. The stay was OK, but just that... OK. I had room 8, I believe. In the room, in the shower, the tray to hold toiletries was missing. So, all of the toiletries had to be picked up off the floor. The drawer in the table was broken. It stuck out and made sitting at the table uncomfortable. Both issues were reported, a staffer came and nothing was done, the tray was not replaced, the drawer was not fixed. I was advised, that "yes" the desks have that problem, and it has been pointed out, and can't be fixed. The breakfasts were as always spectacular, the "chocolate" dinner was revolting. My friend tried the alternative dishes and liked them, I months later still shudder at the not wholly supressed memory of chicken or squab with (ugh) chocolate sauce. Overall, a decent stay, but not a Sofitel Grand experience. The staff, were, as always, absolutely excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler_1037
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 8 days at The Amsterdam Grand. We stayed in an updated room (they are about halfway done with the refurbishing) and I cannot say enough about it. The exterior of the hotel is amazing - the entry way majestic and private. The room was beautiful, the service even better. Our seven year old had her cot already set up in a convenient place in the room with bedding and everything upon our check in. They brought us afternoon snacks of dried fruit, plums and m&m's (with our daughter in mind;-) The room was spotless and spacious. Neils (the person who we booked our reservation with) was so friendly, hospitable and gracious. It was a treat to see him behind the counter on our comings and goings A real asset to the hotel indeed! Upon our arrival our taxi from the airport tried to overcharge us - a few guys from the hotel acted on our behalf and intervened (without us even asking!) and we ended up paying the correct amount. On the way back to the airport they made sure we got an honest taxi driver and a nice cab. That's service! My only gripe would be that the concierge was a bit inconsistent. They certainly tried hard but sometimes the advice on where to eat with our seven year old was a bit off (more bar like that we wanted) BUT when I asked for a list of toy and clothing stores for children he did some research and complied a list (some places which were great - others not so much). A for effort! When I asked for something to be brought to my room, they were there within 1 min of hanging up the phone. I also like that when you received phone messages, they delivered your message to you in a sealed envelope upon your arrival back to the hotel. Very old world. And every person was delightful to our seven year old and genuinely so!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Sofitel The Grand”
Reviews.Author: travellover071
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely. The building is historically and culturally very interesting, and every important sight of Amsterdam is near by. Great service, nice, spacious rooms, absolutely marvellous French cuisine diners!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTSHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel The Grand Amsterdam for 2 nights in early Dec 2008. We took a Connexxion hotel shuttle from the Schiphol airport, and the trip took about 25-30 minutes (with a few other hotel drop-offs). When we tried to check-in at Sofitel, we were told that our booking was not available. We then figured that we were at the wrong hotel (i.e. Sofitel but not Sofitel The Grand)! Fortunately the Connexxion driver was still outside the hotel, and he gave us a ride to the right place. So make sure you communicate the correct hotel name to your driver if you're going to stay there. The hotel itself was a historic and magnificent site. We stayed in a Sofitel suite with courtyard view. The room was huge with a large bed and lounge area, a separate room with closets and a working desk, and a bathroom. The decor and furniture looked a bit old-fashioned at first (e.g. colorful / patterned draperies, tapestry sofa, oak table, etc.), but we actually quite liked them after a while as the ambience was cozy and very different from other contemporary / modern hotels we had previously stayed in. The most important thing was we felt comfortable in the suite. The courtyard (from our window) was nice - would be relaxing to have a walk around there. However, as the weather was rather cold and rainy, we did not spend time out there during our stay. The hotel offered turn-down service in the early evening. Some people might not like it but we were fine and appreciated it. We also enjoyed a complimentary welcome drink at the restaurant. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We bought our tickets to the Van Gogh Museum at the reception / concierge (to avoid line-up at the museum). A hotel staff also recommended a great Indonesian restaurant to us (can't remember the name now...but I did take one of their cards). To sum it up, we were happy with our stay and would certainly go back next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice time at Sofitel Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: LastMinuteDecision
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel through 'a friend of a friend'. As such, I don't have anything bad to say. Our stay was free, and all our needs were met. ...Couldn't ask for more, really. Our room was nice enough, albeit a bit on the small side for my liking. We only stayed one night (which is not uncommon for us, especially since we usually only go to Holland for the weekend), but staff was sure to check that our needs were met at all times. I would definitely stay there again...even if it meant paying. ;-) In fact, I look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Old-fashioned rooms”
Reviews.Author: SixtyDays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst on business. The hotel itself is well located in central Amsterdam though make sure you know how to find it if walking there. The building is impressive and the public space in the lobby is beautiful and what I was hoping the rest of the hotel would look like as well. However, the corridors and rooms were old-fashioned and quite chintzy which was a real disappointed as I was hoping for modern design in an old-fashioned building (similar to the Sofitel Bayerpost in Munich which is a fantastic hotel). I am an A-Club Platinum member so not sure whether I was upgraded, but my room was of a decent size, although the bathroom was not much bigger than a normal hotel room. The room service menu was expensive as expected and the food was ok, but nothing exceptional. Overall, for the price of more than EUR250 per night I was a bit disappointed and had expected more. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is definitely a 5-star hotel with good service, but it is need of a refresh which the renovation program is meant to achieve. Until that is completed I am more likely to stay in another hotel. If you enjoy old-fashioned "classic" hotel room designs you will enjoy the Grand, but for more contemporary design, I would suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “There on Business - Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide408
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a few days at The Grand and overall it was quite nice... I was there for a conference that my company planned and threw and the on-site staff was excellent. The meeting room was quite nice with a Nespresso machine, a retractable screen and natural light! (most conference rooms are always dark and dreary.) The actual hotel room was average, though. For 315 euro a night, i was hoping for something a little bit nicer. The bed was incredibly comfortable, but it was two twin mattresses pushed together... I was there by myself, so it was fine... I would have been annoyed if my husband and I were there together and we had a crack between us! The floors in the guest rooms are heated - which is a nice perk on a rainy day in Amsterdam. Also, the rooms are slightly larger than many European hotel rooms. The internet was insanely expensive to get in your room, so avoid that if you can. The food at the hotel was delicious - I ate at the restaurant for lunch, had room service for dinner one night and had lunch during the conference. The breakfast was included in the room rate but was essentially limited to fruit and pastries. Overall I would certainly recommend this hotel. The location is fantastic and the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with scharm”
Reviews.Author: noj64
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days with my wife. The hotel is very good and the atmosphere is very nice. Very good service from the staff. Please don't do any rehabilitations in the bar area. That area is very good. I did not like the new rooms. To modern. The bed was VERY good. After a long day walk it was very nice to relax in the garden with one Duvel beer and a glas of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanrJones10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. This was our first time at the hotel and we were pleasantly surprised.
